project.name: Hallow & Hearth™: Luxury Candles for Intentional Evenings
project.description: A luxury candle collection for intentional evenings, centered on scent, sound, and atmosphere.

creator.name: Susan States
creator.biography: Susan States is the founder of Hallow & Hearth™, a mood-driven candle brand focused on intentional atmosphere, quality, and everyday rituals. She is also a nurse based in Oklahoma City.

texte: Hallow & Hearth™
The Experience
Hallow & Hearth™ candles are crafted for intentional evenings, with a focus on scent and atmosphere.
Each candle is part of a broader evening ritual, with curated atmosphere and optional soundscapes shared with our community.
This collection is for those who value restraint, quality, and the quiet luxury of choosing how a space feels.
What’s Included
Each Wickedly Hot™ candle is a full-size, hand-poured candle finished with luxury packaging and care details to complete the experience.
Exact candle selections will be made after the campaign via a backer survey.
Made With Care

Every Hallow & Hearth™ candle is made with a soy-based wax blend and thoughtfully chosen ingredients. Our candles are vegan, and our fragrances are free from phthalates and parabens. We focus on high-quality materials and careful formulation so you can enjoy the experience with confidence—whether you’re winding down for the evening or curating a quiet moment at home.
What you can expect
Soy-based wax blend
Vegan
Phthalate-free and paraben-free fragrances
Designed for a clean, enjoyable burn
Meet the three candles that make up the Wickedly Hot™ collection. Each one is designed around a distinct mood—here’s how they each come to life.
Golden Glow, Wicked Slow™

Golden Glow, Wicked Slow™ is your everyday luxury candle—the one you light when you want the evening to feel more intentional. Warm, inviting, and easy to live with, it’s made for quiet moments with a book, slow conversations, or an unhurried end to the day. This is the candle that turns “just another night” into a small ritual you look forward to.
Soft Calm, Wicked Charm™

Soft Calm, Wicked Charm™ is centered on rest, reset, and gentle indulgence. It’s made for bath nights, evening rituals, and moments when you want your space to feel serene and considered. Light this when you’re ready to step into a quieter, more intentional atmosphere and let the room set the tone.
Dark Heat, Wicked Sweet™

Dark Heat, Wicked Sweet™ is your deeper, moodier evening candle. Warm, rich, and a little indulgent, it’s designed for slow nights, late conversations, and setting a more intimate, atmospheric tone. This is the candle you reach for when you want the room to feel cozy, grounded, and just a little bit sultry.
How It Works
1.Choose your reward tier and place your pledge during the campaign.
2. After the campaign ends, you’ll receive a backer survey to select your candle(s) and confirm your shipping details.
3. Candles are produced after funding is complete, with careful attention to quality and packaging.
4. Orders ship once production is finished.
Timeline
Campaign: February 18 – March 10, 2026
Backer surveys sent: March 2026
Production begins: Late March 2026
Orders ship: April 2026 (after Easter)
Fulfillment & Shipping

All candles are produced after the campaign is successfully funded.
Shipping is available within the United States only.
Shipping costs will be charged after the campaign through the backer survey, once rewards are ready to ship.
Risks & Challenges

This project involves the production and fulfillment of physical goods. While timelines may shift slightly due to manufacturing or shipping factors, every effort will be made to communicate clearly and deliver rewards as planned.

Health and Wellness Product Disclaimer: This project and its rewards are not a replacement for medication, medical treatment, or a doctor's examination. Kickstarter does not endorse or verify the veracity of any claims made on project pages, and is not responsible for any opinion, advice, information, or statements made by third parties, including creators. Projects on Kickstarter do not claim to diagnose, treat, or cure any medical condition. The Creator is solely responsible for complying with industry standards and applicable laws, including product safety standards.
About the Creator
Hi, I’m Susan States, founder of Hallow & Hearth™. Alongside my work as a nurse, I’ve been building this brand around the idea that atmosphere is something you choose intentionally.

Hallow & Hearth™ creates mood-driven candles designed to shape how a space feels and how a moment unfolds. This Kickstarter is the first step in bringing that vision to life with the level of care and quality it deserves.

project.name: "Oben Ohne" - magazine project from design students
project.description: Rauchapause, No Pressure, Mischkonsum - a visual dispute with the topic "Unvernunft" from three different perspectives

creator.name: Seit.Hannah
creator.biography:
Heyo lovely people!
I’m Hannah, currently in my fifth semester at the Academy of Illustration and Design in Berlin, and together with my semester, I’m working on a magazine right now. :)

texte:
Liebe bunte Menschen, kreativliebende, staunende, neugierige, forschende Denker...

WIR, 15 aufstrebende Illustrator:innen der AID Berlin, wollen mit Euch unser großes Magazinprojekt ins Leben rufen!

Seit Monaten entwickeln wir bereits hinter den Kulissen „Oben Ohne"- eine Magazinstrecke, die es den Leser:innen möglich macht die Seiten der Unvernunft zu entblättern.

Drei Magazine, drei unterschiedliche Perspektiven, ein großes Thema.

Was ist das eigentlich Unvernunft?
Wie viele Facetten der Unvernunft gibt es zu entdecken?

Wir wollen dazugehören und uns dennoch entfalten. Wir wollen träumen, aber auch realistisch bleiben. Dabei stehen wir oft unter Druck und spüren Gegensätze in uns aufsteigen.

Das Magazin „No Pressure" erzählt aus eigenen Erfahrungen und Beobachtungen, in wie vielen unterschiedlichen Lebensreichen sich Unvernunft im Gewand des Alltages versteckt.

Das Magazin „Rauchapause" will am liebsten einfach mal auf die Pausetaste drücken und sich in Träumereien und unvernünftigen Gewohnheiten flüchten.

Das Magazin „Mischkonsum" will keine Regeln und Grenzen setzen, sondern schlummerndes Unvernunft-Potenzial in uns wecken.

Alle Hefte vereint eines, dass wir uns selbst hinterfragen und Einblicke in unser Leben geben. Mit vielfältigen Illustrationen werden die Artikel nicht nur mit Worten, sondern besonders stark mit unseren Bildwelten erzählt.

Wir wollen euch einladen mit uns in jene Bildwelten abzutauchen und freuen uns sehr über Eure finanzielle Unterstützung.

Wir brauchen 1.500 Euro für die Produktion unserer kleinen Magazinstrecken-Auflage.

Das Ganze wird voraussichtlich im März gedruckt, wenn wir genügend Unterstützer:innen finden.

Wir freuen uns über jeden, der uns jungen Kreativschaffenden die Möglichkeit gibt, so ein großes Projekt mit Leidenschaft umzusetzen und hoffentlich bald den Duft von frischbedrucktem Papier in den Händen zu halten.
English Version:

Dear colourful souls, lovers of creativity, wonderers, curious minds, and inquisitive thinkers…
We, 15 emerging illustrators from AID Berlin want to bring our major magazine project to life together with you!

For months now, we’ve been working behind the scenes on “Oben Ohne”, a magazine series that invites readers to peel back the pages of Unvernunft. Three magazines, three different perspectives, one shared theme. What is Unvernunft, really?
How many facets of Unvernunft are there to discover? We want to belong, yet still unfold. We want to dream, but also stay realistic. Along the way, we often feel pressure and sense contradictions rising within us.

The magazine “No Pressure” draws from personal experiences and observations to explore the many areas of life where Unvernunft hides in the clothing of everyday routines. The magazine “Rauchapause” longs to hit the pause button, drifting into daydreams and delightfully unvernünftige habits. The magazine “Mischkonsum” refuses to set rules or boundaries, instead awakening the dormant potential for Unvernunft within us. All three issues share one thing: we question ourselves and offer glimpses into our lives. Through a wide range of illustrations, the articles are told not only through words, but powerfully through our visual worlds.

We invite you to dive into these visual worlds with us and we are deeply grateful for your financial support. We need €1,500 to produce our small magazine print run. Printing is planned for March, provided we find enough supporters. We appreciate everyone who gives us young creatives the opportunity to bring such a passionate project to life and hopefully soon hold the scent of freshly printed pages in our hands.
English subtitels for the video:
Hey guys,
I'm Kaya from the 5th semester of the Akademie for Illustration und Design Berlin.
We currently work on a collaborative magazine project about our topic "Unvernunft" (translates to irrationality, unreasonability)

In three different editions we address serious topics such as society criticism as well as foolish nonsense from our everyday life. To fulfill our goal, we opened an Instagram account where you can watch behind the scenes moment or follow our progress. We also opened a Kickstarter campaign, opening the possibility for those who want to financially support us. If we were able to make you interested, we'd be very glad if you'd take a look! Thank you very much!

project.name: The Stamp Collection - Travel Series 2
project.description: Each pin in this collection is inspired by beloved travel destinations - iconic cities, countries, states, and natural wonders.

creator.name: Katie & Xiomara
creator.biography: Hi! ✨ We're Katie and Xiomara, the illustrators and designers behind Joy Addict! We love to make the world a bit more magical by creating enamel pins and illustrated art prints. We are pastel lovers, book readers, and best friends! Thanks for checking out our kickstarter! ♡

texte: ♡ ALL PINS UNLOCKED! ♡
♡ IMPORTANT SHIPPING INFO - Shipping will be charged separately from the Kickstarter via the platform BackerKit. See more details below under "Shipping". ♡
♡ FREEBIE STICKER SHEET - All 4+ pin pledges will receive a free Travel Series 2 STICKER SHEET! ♡

♡ PIN SELECTION - You will choose which designs you would like after the campaign ends, in a Backer Survey email. Choose your tier based on the amount of pins you want from this campaign. You can add on other items from our shop separately in the survey ♡

We're Katie & Xiomara, best friends and the illustrators behind the brand Joy Addict! Five years ago we created the Stamp Collection based on our love of books, movies, pins, and pastels. Eight campaigns and over 100 pins later, we are continue to grow our series with iconic travel destinations!

If you love exploring new places (or day-dreaming of them like us), this collection is perfect for showing a little adventure in your everyday life. Each pin is illustrated to capture well loved destinations including iconic cities, amazing countries, beautiful states, and breathtaking nature, all framed in the oh so cute shape of a postage stamp. With soft pastels and screen-printed accents, these pins make for a perfect travel diary. This new collection will include 10 pins total (with stretch goals to come of course!).

Pledging helps unlock designs, and you can pledge for whichever pins you want, regardless of their locked/unlocked status – during the first eight stamp collections, all 10 designs were unlocked in the first hour and we're sure all 10 will get unlocked this time too! ♡

Pledge now risk-free and pay later!  At any point during the campaign, you can increase, decrease or even cancel your pledge, you will only be charged when the campaign ends and if the goal has been achieved.

As a backer of our campaign, you will not only help make these pins happen, but will also receive a discount! Once the campaign has ended and after all rewards have been fulfilled, the remaining pins will be sold for a higher price in our shop!

We are including a freebie Travel Series 2 Sticker Sheet for any pledge of 4 pins or more! We are super grateful for the continued the support of this collection and each of our campaigns and love to express our thanks in stickers ♡

We are also offering a Travel Series 2 Washi Roll with this campaign ♡ It's available in its own tier, or you can add it on to your pledge after the campaign within the backer survey, see further below for the add-on info.

Besides Stamp Washi Tape we also are offering Large Vinyl Stickers, perfect for decorating a laptop, water bottle, notebook or more. You will be able to add these on to your pledges after the campaign, within the backer survey.
IMPORTANT INFO // We will be offering add-ons of ANY ITEM FROM OUR SHOP via the platform BackerKit!

We are excited to once again offer the ability to add on other products from the campaign or from our shop, including our other pins, Stamp Washi and Art Prints! We've used BackerKit many times and are so happy with how easy it makes adding on products :)
You will get the option to add on other items from our shop AFTER the campaign ends, within the Backer Survey which we will email to you.

IMPORTANT INFO - Shipping costs will be charged to you AFTER the campaign and SEPARATELY through the BackerKit survey that you will get via email.

Since we are giving backers the ability to add on items from the campaign or our shop, shipping will need to be calculated for each order, and isn't a "one size fits all" flat rate. To get an approximate idea of what you will be charged for shipping see below. Shipping cost can vary a bit depending on your location and whether you add on items or not. The numbers below are approximate estimates and the final shipping cost will be calculated after the campaign through the BackerKit survey.
For domestic backers:

All pin parcels within the United States will receive a tracking number once the orders are shipped!

For international backers:

International parcels are shipped using a Global Advantage Program. This postage method only has very basic tracking in order to keep costs low for international backers. Packages very rarely get lost in the mail, but if in the unlikely event this does happen, just reach out to us and we will make sure you are taken care of. We can be reached by email at: hello@joyaddict.co
Also, please be aware that International backers are responsible for any customs fees their country may ask for, so plan accordingly.

Thank you so much for your support of this campaign!

We are very excited to continue to grow our Stamp Collection with the real world locations that inspire and amaze us. We hope you love the new designs, and if you have any suggestions for locations you'd love to see, let us know!

With Gratitude ♡

Katie & Xiomara

Instagram: @Joy.Addict

project.name: The Lúth Core Tee
project.description: A natural-fibre performance tee built to last. Designed in Ireland. Made in Portugal.

creator.name: Joe Canning
creator.biography:
I’m Joe, based in the west of Ireland.
I started Lúth after getting tired of replacing t-shirts that didn’t last or perform as promised.
I set out to build one I could wear daily and train in without it losing its shape.
That meant working with specialist mills in Portugal to get it right.

texte: Most t-shirts fall into two categories.

They either feel great at first, then lose their shape.
Or they perform well but feel synthetic and overly sporty outside the gym.

So we end up owning too many.
And trusting none of them to do it all.
One that genuinely does both is rare.
The Lúth Core Tee is designed to replace the rotation.

A performance-ready t-shirt for real life.
Clean silhouette. Natural feel. Built to hold its shape.
Made in Portugal from a custom 62% TENCEL™ Lyocell / 30% Organic Cotton / 8% Elastane blend, engineered at 220gsm for durability without heaviness.
Soft. Breathable. Structured.

Buy fewer t-shirts.
Wear them more.
Keep them longer.

• Ultra-soft and naturally breathable
TENCEL™ Lyocell gives the fabric a smooth, cool feel against the skin: never shiny, never synthetic.

• Luxury comfort, everyday performance
Moisture-regulating and quick-drying for comfort during movement, travel, and long days.

• Durable and shape-retaining
A refined Portuguese knitting process helps maintain clean drape, structure, and resistance to sagging over time.
This fabric is the foundation of the Core Tee — everything else is built around it.
Engineered at 220gsm for durability without heaviness.
Every detail of the Lúth Core Tee is designed for movement, comfort, and a clean everyday silhouette.

• Built to last
Reinforced seams and precision Portuguese construction help maintain a consistent fit and structure over time.

• Tailored, athletic drape
A refined cut that skims the body without clinging.

• Balanced length
Stays put during movement without looking long or oversized.

• Thoughtfully shaped sleeves
A natural taper that adds structure without restricting movement.
Effortless shape. Everyday comfort.

The Core Tee has a unisex athletic fit with a slightly relaxed silhouette.
Designed to feel clean and balanced across a wide range of body types.

Male model is 189cm (6'2") wearing size L for an athletic fit.
Female model is 170cm (5'7") wearing size S for a relaxed fit.

How to choose your size
If you prefer a standard athletic fit, choose your usual size.
For a closer silhouette, consider sizing down.
For a looser feel, size up.
Final production measurements will be confirmed during the campaign.

Size selections will be collected after the campaign ends.
You will be able to adjust your size before production begins.

• World-class craftsmanship
Home to some of Europe’s most respected textile mills.

• Technical consistency
Performance-focused production supports consistency in fit, feel, and construction.
Produced in small runs to maintain consistency and quality.

• EU-regulated manufacturing
Strong labour and environmental standards.

• Short supply chain
Closer production allows tighter quality control and reduced transport impact.
Premium materials deserve premium craftsmanship.
Kickstarter allows us to produce the first limited run of the Lúth Core Tee without overproducing or cutting corners.
Early backer support funds the initial production run and sets the foundation for what comes next.
The first run will be limited.
As an early backer, you’ll have the opportunity to secure the Core Tee at a reduced price while supporting an Irish-based business working with trusted EU manufacturing partners.
Once allocated, standard retail pricing will apply.
If this resonates with you, backing early directly helps bring Lúth to life.
This is the first opportunity to own the Lúth Core Tee — available exclusively through Kickstarter ahead of our wider retail release.

• A premium, Portuguese-made performance tee
Crafted from our custom-developed 62% Lyocell / 30% Organic Cotton / 8% Elastane blend.

• Your choice of size
From XS to XL.

• Peat Black — Kickstarter Launch Edition 
The Lúth Core Tee, produced in limited quantities with early backer support.

• Exclusive Early Backer pricing
Limited to the first 50 backers at €55.

• Worldwide shipping
With reduced Kickstarter rates for Ireland, the EU, the UK & the US.
Most backers choose a bundle to replace their weekly rotation.

€55 — Early Backer Lúth Core Tee
Limited to the first 50 backers (30 Super Early + 20 Early).
Lowest Kickstarter price.

€110 — Rotation Pack (2 Tees) (Most popular)
Two Core Tees designed to replace your weekly rotation.
Exclusive campaign bundle pricing.

€165 — Daily Pack (3 Tees)
The complete Lúth foundation.
Best overall campaign value.

€59 — Kickstarter Edition
The standard Kickstarter release of the Lúth Core Tee.
Campaign price.
Retail price post-campaign: €75
Thank you for helping bring Lúth to life.

The most sustainable garment is one you wear again and again.
Our fabric and construction prioritise longevity, shape stability, and long-term comfort — reducing the need for frequent replacement.
4 prototypes. 6 months of testing. Refined for longevity, shape stability and comfort.
TENCEL™ Lyocell and Organic Cotton form the base of our fabric blend — sourced from established mills and processed with reduced water and chemical use compared to conventional alternatives.
Crafted in northern Portugal under strict EU labour and environmental standards.
European sourcing and production reduce transport emissions and allow tighter oversight.
Thoughtful materials. Responsible production.

March 2026 — Final fabrics approved & production begins
April 2026 — Cutting, sewing, finishing
May 2026 — Quality control + packaging
June 2026 — Worldwide shipping begins (estimated)
We have built buffer into the timeline to prioritise quality and avoid rushing the first production run.
We ship worldwide from Ireland. Backers receive reduced shipping rates as part of the Kickstarter launch.

Ireland: €8
UK: €12
EU & Switzerland: €12
US: €20
Rest of World: €25
Shipping is calculated by region. Multi-tee packs may incur additional shipping due to weight.
Any local taxes or import duties (if applicable) are determined by your delivery country and handled at checkout or on delivery, in line with Kickstarter’s policies.
Backers will receive updates at each key stage of production, and again once orders are dispatched.
I built Lúth because I couldn’t find a t-shirt that felt good enough to live in and still train in.

Between long working days, training sessions, and travel, I found myself packing two shirts for one day. Premium tees felt great at first, then lost their shape. Performance tees worked well, but felt synthetic and looked too technical outside the gym.
I began working with specialist mills and manufacturers in northern Portugal to develop a considered everyday t-shirt built for movement, comfort, and longevity.
Based in the west of Ireland, Lúth is an Irish word associated with movement and vitality. A reminder that movement doesn’t have to be loud. It can be quiet, consistent, and part of everyday life.

This is the first Lúth product.
Designed to be worn often.
Lived in.
Kept.
Let’s build something that lasts.

project.name: Woolle:Odorless, Non-Toxic Moth Protection for Wool Lovers
project.description: 70 Years of Proven Rug Care—Now in a DIY Kit for Safe, Long-Lasting Protection of Your Wool, Rugs, and Heirlooms from moths.

creator.name: Austin Reinders
creator.biography: Austin Reinders is the founder of Woolle, reviving a proven, non-toxic mothproofing formula. With decades of textile care expertise, he’s dedicated to protecting woolens and restoring a lost industry solution for today’s world.

titre: The Lost Legacy of Woolle: How a Forgotten Formula Came Back to Life
Research & Safety: What’s in Woolle and Why You Can Trust It
texte: The early 1920s marked a period of explosive growth for New York City. Skyscrapers began to pierce the skyline, and neighborhoods filled with families eager to enjoy the comforts of modern living. Among the prized possessions filling these homes were woolen goods—rugs, tapestries, fur coats, sweaters, and suits. Wool, known for its warmth and durability, became a symbol of prosperity and refinement.

But as the city grew denser and more goods were stored away, a silent invader found its opportunity: the carpet moth. These tiny insects, harmless as adults, laid eggs that hatched into larvae—voracious eaters of animal-based fibers. Over time, the damage escalated from a nuisance to a citywide crisis. Homeowners watched in dismay as their prized textiles were devoured from within, the larvae spinning cocoons and emerging as moths to restart the cycle.

The scale of the problem demanded a scientific response. Laboratories across the country, and especially in New York, began searching for a chemical deterrent. By the mid-1920s, researchers discovered that certain fluoride compounds could be highly effective against moth larvae. Among the pioneers was the Larvex Corporation, which patented a water-soluble, non-toxic, and odorless solution: ammonium silicofluoride. This innovation was safe for home use, gentle on wool, and easy to apply—though it required reapplication after cleaning, as it was not permanent.

Still, the quest for a permanent fix continued. Sodium fluoride, paired with an acid solution, offered longer-lasting protection but proved harsh on both wool and skin. Over time, the risks outweighed the benefits, and the industry returned to safer, though temporary, solutions.

The story of mothproofing did not end with Larvex. The company was eventually absorbed by a larger conglomerate, and by the 1930s–40s, both the patents and the formulas faded into obscurity. Yet, the knowledge was not entirely lost. On the East Coast and in select Bay Area rug plants, cleaning specialists continued to use these formulas, passing them down through generations or company sales.

Cary Cleaning Specialists, a Bay Area institution from the 1930s to 1960s, became stewards of the ammonium silicofluoride method. When Simonian Rugs acquired Cary Cleaning Specialists in 1956, they inherited not just a business, but a legacy of textile protection. For decades, Simonian Rugs quietly safeguarded the region’s rugs and tapestries, using a formula that had all but disappeared elsewhere.

In the 1970s, Joseph Bezjidian, owner of Simonian Rug Cleaners, formally acquired Cary’s mothproofing solution and continued to use it in his facility. The Simonian family, drawing on generations of expertise in textile care, maintained the tradition, even as the rest of the industry moved on to other methods—freezing, heat treatments, mothballs, and scented deterrents. These alternatives, while helpful, often failed to match the effectiveness and safety of the original formula.

In 2008, Austin Reinders took ownership of Simonian Rugs, unaware that he was now the custodian of a nearly lost piece of textile history. For years, the formula was offered as a specialized service, protecting countless heirlooms and everyday items. It wasn’t until 2024, at a rug cleaning convention, that Austin realized just how rare the solution had become. Colleagues from across the country described their reliance on physical methods and scented repellents—none had access to the odorless, effective formula that Simonian Rugs had quietly preserved.

Recognizing a unique opportunity, Austin set out to bring the solution to the public. Woolle was born—a brand with a modern identity, designed to make mothproofing accessible, safe, and effective for everyone. With a carefully chosen color palette (dark blue, white, and salmon) and thoughtfully designed kits, Woolle empowers consumers to protect their woolen treasures at home. Each kit includes a gallon of mothproofing spray, a funnel for mixing concentrate with distilled water, and a fine-mist spray bottle for easy application.
Before announcing Woolle to the public, we wanted to ensure that our solution would be safe for homes, families, and treasured garments. Here’s what we found:

Ammonium silicofluoride (also known as ammonium fluorosilicate), with the formula (NH₄)₂SiF₆, is a white, water-soluble crystalline powder. It’s non-staining, odorless, and has a long history of safe use in textile care when properly diluted.

Origin: Industrially, ammonium silicofluoride is produced by reacting ammonia with hexafluorosilicic acid—a byproduct of phosphate fertilizer manufacturing. Historically, it could also be found as a secondary byproduct in the ash from burning coal or from volcanic activity, where natural minerals react to form similar compounds.

Safety: When diluted for textile use, ammonium silicofluoride is considered low-toxicity, non-combustible, and safe for home environments. It does not leave harmful residues or odors. We have verified its safety profile through reputable sources, including PubChem, CAMEO Chemicals, and industry literature.

Effectiveness: The compound works by dehydrating moth larvae, disrupting their lifecycle and preventing damage to wool, cashmere, and other animal-based fibers. Its water solubility allows for easy, even application on garments and rugs.

We chose this formula because it offers the best combination of safety, effectiveness, and ease of use. Woolle is gentle on your favorite sweaters and heirloom rugs—giving you peace of mind and real protection without harsh chemicals or lingering scents.

Woolle stands as a testament to the power of tradition, innovation, and family stewardship. For over a century, the secrets of effective mothproofing were nearly lost—buried by corporate mergers, forgotten by changing industries, and safeguarded by a handful of dedicated practitioners. Today, Woolle revives this legacy, offering a proven, non-toxic, and water-based solution to a new generation of textile lovers.
Through Woolle, the world’s woolen treasures can once again be protected—just as they were in the golden age of New York’s textile boom. The lost solution has found its way home.

Paired with our organic lavender booster, you’ll add a long-lasting, natural freshness to your storage spaces while gaining an extra layer of moth deterrence. project.name: Hands Free Q Leash - Simple. Functional. Freedom.
project.description: Creating a hands free leash with options, comfy stylish pack, 5' coil tensioner or 16' attachable retractable leash.

creator.name: Q Pet Products
creator.biography: Just a guy with his dog trying to make pet ownership a little more fun-ctional. Big ideas, this just the beginning of our journey to making quality, working, well-thought out designed pet products.

texte: It all started with a rescue pup named Cookie who immediately had a name change to Queen (Q). Named after the most powerful piece on the chess board, I never knew it would have such a strong resemblance to her personality. Strong, spoiled, powerful, and well..a Queen.

Queen grew up "off leash" and constantly exploring, we often were moving around within her first few years and constantly on the go. We settled in a town North of Miami, where when I would walk Q off leash I often was getting a lot of negative feedback. However she never left my side, bothered anyone, and was always well behaved I didn't think she deserved to have to be tied to 3 feet directly to my hand. We enjoyed roller blading, bike riding, beach runs all without the need of a leash.

Then came the time, where we just had to be on a leash - I started to find a way to give her the freedom I wanted her to have, until we got to where we were going to set her free. It started with cheap 'hands free' leashes with bad designs, inexpensive packs, constantly getting loose or not fitting correctly, falling off my waist, not stylish. I didn't think there was much in the market for me. After brainstorming, coming up with some ideas and a LOT of product sampling, I finally was able to create something I could use and thought was stylish.

Prototype development began, and testing has been ongoing. I have now personally been using my prototype over a year without any issue and have slowly been working to get a product to market. Who knew how expensive being passionate about animals could be..

This started as a bit of a passion project for me, and turned into something I want to be able to offer the public. An affordable, stylish, well made product with functionality to allow them a little more freedom while walking their pup. The idea is to secure some funding to build inventory, create more colors, advance some of the prototypes moving beyond just this version 1. Growing the Q Pet Products into a complete brand that offers a multitude of well thought out products making life easier for pet owners.

This project is as close to my heart as it gets, Q and I have been together in the tightest of bonds for over 5 years now. She is the reason for the Q Leash, her and I both hope that people enjoy it as much as we have.

project.name: The Diane: your Day changes, your Bag does too
project.description: The "Diane" handbag by Hémisphère Sud Paris. Crafted to deliver flexibility and functionality without compromising elegance and luxury.

creator.name: Hémisphère Sud
creator.biography:
Hémisphère Sud est aujourd’hui une rencontre entre deux générations, deux visions.

Anne Lévigne, créatrice dans l’âme, dessine depuis l’enfance et consacre sa vie au voyage, au matières nobles, et à la protection & transmission des savoir-faire.

Alexander Fletcher, entrepreneur et technophile, apporte une lecture contemporaine des usages, des données et des nouveaux modes de vie.

Hémisphère Sud est né de cette alliance & de cette relève familiale: la tradition et l’innovation, l’intuition créative et la rigueur technologique.

Notre ambition est de réinventer le luxe, de le rendre plus intelligent,
plus adapté à la vie réelle, et plus responsable dans sa durée.

texte: Hello Kickstarter,

We at HEMISPHERE SUD believe leather goods should be adaptable, without compromising the beauty of their design. That’s why we have created DIANE, an expandable handcrafted tote bag, designed in France, and built to follow every step of your journey. Relying on over 40 years of experience in sourcing, design and craftsmanship for some of the most luxurious international brands, we are launching our first independent collection!

Why did we choose Kickstarter?
We chose Kickstarter to launch our brand because it perfectly aligns with our philosophy of creative independence and sustainability:
This way, every supporter benefits directly from economies of scale and optimised use of materials, which means minimum stocks, ensuring better value, flexibility and a more eco-friendly approach.
Why Diane?
In Roman mythology, Diane is the goddess of the hunt, free, elegant, and in perpetual motion.
Like her, our expanding tote embodies independence and adaptability: crafted to follow your rhythm, from city to escape, with timeless Parisian style.

The idea behind this project comes from a frustration we’ve had for years: finding a tote that could truly keep up with our lives. Most leather totes look beautiful at first sight, but when you actually live with them, their limits quickly appear. They are often too rigid, too heavy, and lock you into a fixed shape that only works some of the time. On the other hand, the more flexible options we tried were practical, but lacked the timeless style and craftsmanship that make a bag a pleasure to carry every day.

In short, we were always forced to choose: either beauty without functionality, or practicality without elegance. And the more we searched, the more we felt that this compromise was unnecessary. Why couldn’t a tote be both refined and adaptive? Why couldn’t it respect tradition, yet reinvent itself for modern life?

That’s when Diane was born. Instead of accepting the existing rules, we decided to create our own solution - a tote that expands or contracts according to your needs, handcrafted in smooth leather, and rooted in Parisian originality. A bag that finally solves the frustration we had been living with for years.
In a fluid motion, transform your compact Diane into a spacious tote.

From a compact tube-shaped bag taking no room on the shelf of your dressing, which will be a handy city bag, the Diane can expand into a light and large tote bag by simply unclipping 6 secure press studs.

Dimensions (folded)
- Medium (M): 39 × 9 × 9 cm
- Large (L): 44 × 9 × 9 cm

Dimensions (unfolded)
- Medium (M): 39 × 38 × 9 cm
- Large (L): 44 × 45 × 9 cm

Materials:
- Full-grain calf leather, smooth, soft, durable, sustainably produced
- High-quality technical nylon, lightweight, water-resistant, luxurious matte finish
- Premium YKK zippers, polished, reliable, long-lasting
- Refined metal hardware with matte finish, minimal, discreet, functional
- Strong adapted reinforced structure
- Individually hand mounted
- Refined reusable felt protection wrap
Comes with:

- Your personalised embossed initials
- Leather care maintenance leaflet 
- Guarantee of manufacturing quality
- One off white embroidered felt wrap
- A beautiful upcycled reusable wooden box
- Sets of gifts in matching leather created to thank our backers, featuring a key holder (€40 value), a luggage tag (€50 value), and an original passport sleeve (€80 value)

Hémisphère Sud is a family journey of craftsmanship. Our historical atelier has been shaping leather goods for over 40 years, designing for some of the world’s most prestigious Maisons before bringing our own creations to life.

What drives us is simple: creating pieces that carry meaning. Every bag is born where reinvention meets tradition, and where design is treated not just as utility but as an expression of life and movement.

Today, mother and son are writing the next chapter together, blending new ideas with savoir-faire, innovation with heritage. The Diane is the first step of this new chapter that we are excited to share with you.

Our bags are crafted from premium materials: a luxurious Hazelnut 2-tone smooth full grain leather, and a choice of durable nylons especially made in Korea, in light cream or deep black. Each material has been carefully selected for its balance of elegance, quality and resilience, ensuring a product that lasts.

Backers will be able to select their preferred colour at the closing of the Kickstarter campaign [Closing Date 8th April] by email. See the stretch goals below to discover which additional colours will be unlocked.

The Diane is not just a tote, it’s the result of craftsmanship, quality materials, and a totally unique design that reinvents how a bag adapts to your life and moves with you. Here are 5 reasons why we believe these prices reflect their true value & make us stand out as the most thoughtful choice in modern leather design:

1- Materials of uncompromising quality
The Diane combines full-grain calf leather with special nylon selected with purpose and intent. Smooth, durable leather for the structure, and lightweight, water-resistant nylon for the body. Add premium YKK Excella zippers and discreet nickel color hardware, and you get a bag built to last.
Kickstarter enables us to order the right amounts of materials, at the best price, so we do not compromise on quality.

2- Details that matter
Every stitch is purposeful: reinforced leather handles, hidden seams, refined finishes. Even the zipper pullers are cut and hand-finished in our workshop. No shortcuts.

3- Not “just a tote”
The Diane expands when you need it, and stays minimal when you don’t. It’s two bags in one: a sleek everyday model and a larger tote bag. A modular system that adapts to your lifestyle instead of forcing you to adapt to the bag.

4- French savoir-faire
France’s leather working tradition is among the most respected in the world, but also ensures timeless quality.

5- A fair price for true value
While other luxury brands charge 500–1,200€ for comparable bags, we keep our price fair by going direct-to-consumer. No middlemen, no retail markups, just honest pricing for a premium original product.

And for our Kickstarter backers only, we’re offering the Medium sized Diane at 230€ and Large sized one at 280€ instead of the future retail prices of 295€ and 350€ - as well as some early backer rewards!

We believe luxury should not come at the expense of the planet. That’s why we carefully select leathers from responsibly managed tanneries, minimize waste during cutting and production, avoid all unnecessary chemicals, and use eco-conscious felt packaging that can be easily repurposed. Every bag is crafted to last, reusing the need for frequent replacements and promoting a more sustainable approach to fashion.
Questions about this project? Check out the FAQ
For more information, visit our website: www.hemispheresud.com

project.name: B&M (Bold and Modern) Global Culture: A Fashion Revolution
project.description: Bold Designs. Global Stories. Shared Identity

creator.name: Moise Bisimwa Moses
creator.biography:
I have always been driven by creativity. From an early age, I immersed myself in the performing arts, actively participating in theatre as a thespian. The discipline of rehearsals, the intensity of stage lights, and the responsibility of conveying emotion before an audience shaped my understanding of expression and storytelling. Music has remained equally important in my life; I often return to the piano, allowing creativity to guide me, especially during challenging moments.

Having grown up across several African countries, I was exposed to a rich diversity of languages, cultures, rhythms, and traditions. These experiences profoundly influenced how I see the world and how I approach creative work. Relocating to Canada as a teenager required me to navigate a new cultural environment while preserving the depth of my heritage. A pivotal moment came when I first walked a runway. That experience awakened a new level of confidence and self-assurance, reinforcing the importance of identity and presence.

In 2024, I founded **Bold & Modern Global Culture (B&M)** in Montreal, Quebec. What began as a vision developed independently from my room—with limited resources but strong determination—has grown into a purpose-driven fashion brand. B&M blends authentic cultural influences with refined, modern streetwear design. The goal is to create pieces—hoodies, jackets, and accessories—that allow individuals to celebrate their heritage in a contemporary and empowering way.

For me, this brand is deeply personal. Each design carries a narrative, much like theatre and music. I want every person who wears B&M to feel pride in their roots, confidence in their identity, and connection to a broader global community. Beyond fashion, the brand is committed to giving back through cultural workshops and community initiatives that support creativity and self-expression.

Faith remains central to my journey- God first, always.

I continue to combine creativity with technical skill, coding professionally while building the future of B&M. The vision is long-term: to build something meaningful, impactful, and culturally unifying.

www.bmglobalculture.com

project.name: Stardew Valley Bachelors - Acrylic Keychain Charms
project.description: A series of new keychain charms featuring cute original artwork of the bachelors from Stardew Valley!

creator.name: Avmire
creator.biography: I'm a digital artist that loves drawing and animating for the media I enjoy, such as anime, games, shows, and more! I want to share a bit of the excitement and joy that I get when I see amazing artwork of something I love.

texte: Hello hello! I'm Avmire, an artist who creates keychains, stickers, and prints of my favorite media and fandoms! I sell merchandise of my artwork in my Etsy shop, and post digital artwork on Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube.

Pledging here on Kickstarter guarantees production of this keychain series! If the campaign is successful, any remaining keychains or stickers will be available for purchase in my Etsy shop. Restocks are not guaranteed, so secure your charms by pledging during the campaign period!

These acrylic keychain charms will have the design featured on both sides, with a protective film that can be kept on or removed at your preference. The acrylic keychains and vinyl stickers are both 2.5 inches tall (~ 6.3cm).
There is a limited early bird bonus that includes a free vinyl sticker of your choice! This can be of the same bachelor for your charm, or a different one.
Want multiple designs? No worries! Pledging is based on number of keychains desired, and you can select which bachelor(s) you want via survey after the campaign ends.
Pledge now, pay later! You will only be charged if the project is successfully funded at the end of the 21-day period. Update your pledge at any time during the campaign.
Check out a snippet of my process below!
Please keep in mind that this is a rough estimate and may vary! If something occurs that impacts the timeline, I will send out an update.
There may also be shipping delays, especially for those who live outside the United States.

project.name: Soul-Crafted Stones: Bespoke Gemstone Jewelry
project.description: A personalized journey to your highest self. We curate Grade 7A natural crystals based on your unique birth energy and life intentions.

creator.name: Wilson
creator.biography:
I am a jewelry designer based in the heart of Canada’s Pacific Northwest, where the raw beauty of the mountains and the clarity of the glacial waters serve as my daily inspiration. My work is a bridge between the ancient wisdom of crystal energy and the clean, understated elegance of modern Canadian design.

With a deep-rooted passion for energy culture, I spent years studying the vibrational properties of minerals. I found that most spiritual jewelry was either too ornate or too heavy for a contemporary lifestyle. This led me to develop a signature style centered on 4mm micro-beads and precision-cut facets, creating pieces that feel like a delicate extension of the wearer.

My design philosophy is simple: Intention in every bead. I hand-select 7A-grade natural stones not just for their aesthetic brilliance, but for their ability to bring focus, serenity, and confidence to the modern soul. By integrating 14K Gold-Filled elements, I ensure each piece is as durable as it is beautiful—a timeless companion for your daily journey

texte: Based in the heart of the Pacific Northwest, Canada, I have always been captivated by the raw, untamed energy of our landscapes—from the crystalline glacial waters to the golden light of the summer solstice.

As a designer and a long-time believer in crystal energy, I struggled to find jewelry that matched my minimalist aesthetic. Most spiritual pieces felt too heavy or 'loud' for daily wear. I wanted something that felt as light as a whisper on the wrist, yet carried the profound resonance of the Earth.

The Sol Collection was born in my studio in Montreal. It is a fusion of Canadian minimalist design and ancient mineral wisdom. Each 7A-grade stone is hand-selected to ensure it reflects the same purity as our northern wilderness. By combining these stones with the 14K Gold-Filled Sun charm, I aim to provide a wearable 'sanctuary' for modern souls navigating a chaotic world.

gone.name: The Uncut Energy Crystal
gone.desc:
Before the polishing, before the shaping, there is the raw stone.

Experience the minerals in their most powerful and unadulterated state with our 'Untouched Crystal' reward. These are hand-selected rough specimens, taken directly from the source earth. They have not been cut, treated, or altered in any way.

Each piece holds the primal energy and natural formations of its origin. Perfect for grounding your meditation space, adding to a mineral collection, or simply carrying a piece of raw nature with you. Because they are untouched, every single crystal is completely one-of-a-kind—a unique fingerprint of the Earth shaped over millennia.

Own the genesis of our jewelry collection.

Includes:
5 × Hand-selected Raw Crystal Specimen (Clear Quartz, Aquamarine, Sunstone, Moonstone, and Amethyst)

Note: Nature makes each piece unique. Size, shape, and clarity will vary significantly.

gone.name: Solace Clarity
gone.desc:
Experience the pure essence of mindfulness with the Solace Clarity bracelet. Crafted from top-tier 7A-grade Clear Quartz, this piece is designed to amplify your focus, cleanse surrounding energies, and bring a sense of serene order to your busy day.

Each bracelet is delicately accented with our signature Gold-Filled Sun Charm, symbolizing a radiant path and constant clarity. Its design makes it the perfect everyday companion—elegant enough to wear alone, yet subtle enough for stacking with your other favorite pieces.

gone.name: Oceanic Solace
gone.desc:
Dive into a state of pure tranquility with the Oceanic Solace bracelet. Featuring breathtaking Aquamarine beads, this piece mirrors the shimmering hues of a sun-drenched lagoon. Known as the stone of eternal youth and happiness, Aquamarine is believed to soothe the soul and provide a shield of protection for those who journey.

The design is elevated by our signature Gold-Filled Sun Charm and accented with minimalist gold square beads, creating a sophisticated contrast between the cool blue tones and warm golden radiance. It ensures a comfortable fit for all-day wear, whether you’re navigating the boardroom or walking along the shore.

gone.name: Eternal Noon
gone.desc:
Capture the warmth of a permanent midday sun with the Eternal Noon bracelet. This piece features select Sunstone beads, a gemstone celebrated for its vibrant energy and the way it seems to hold a flicker of sunlight within. Known as the stone of leadership and personal power, Sunstone is believed to instill good nature and heighten intuition.

The bracelet is beautifully complemented by our signature Gold-Filled Sun Charm, a symbol of vitality and your own inner light. Small golden accent beads are interspersed to mirror the natural "aventurescence" of the stones, creating a piece that feels both grounded and spiritually uplifting. It is an elegant, minimalist statement for those who lead with warmth and shine from within.

gone.name: Echoes of Daylight
gone.desc:
Experience a poetic dialogue between the silver moon and the golden sun with the Echoes of Daylight bracelet. This piece features ethereal Moonstone, a gem celebrated for its "adularescence"—a mystical, milky-blue glow that dances beneath the surface like moonlight on water. As a stone of new beginnings and inner growth, Moonstone is believed to soothe emotional instability and enhance intuition.

The cool, translucent serenity of the stones is beautifully grounded by our signature Gold-Filled Sun Charm. This contrast symbolizes the perfect balance between your quiet reflection and your outward radiance. Interspersed with delicate gold accent beads, this minimalist design is a reminder that even in the softest light, the warmth of the sun is never far away.

gone.name: Amethyst Aura
gone.desc:
Unlock the profound stillness of the mind with the Amethyst Aura bracelet. This piece is defined by its icy, transparent Amethyst beads, each meticulously faceted to capture and refract light from every angle, mirroring the clarity of a sharp, intuitive mind. Long revered as the stone of spiritual protection and sobriety, Amethyst is believed to transform negative energy into love and tranquility.

The deep, regal violet of the stones is centered by our signature Gold-Filled Sun Charm, creating a striking visual metaphor for the sun shining through a mystical twilight. Paired with sleek golden square accents, this design offers a modern, sophisticated silhouette that bridges the gap between ancient stone lore and contemporary elegance. It is the ultimate accessory for those who seek to move through the world with grace, wisdom, and a calm, focused spirit.

gone.name: Sol & Luna: The Celestial Balance Set
gone.desc:
Why choose between the radiance of the day and the magic of the night? The Sol & Luna Set brings together our most symbolic pair: the vibrant Eternal Noon (Sunstone) and the ethereal Echoes of Daylight (Moonstone).

This duo is designed for those who seek perfect harmony in their lives. The Sunstone ignites your outward passion, leadership, and vitality, while the Moonstone nurtures your inner intuition, calm, and grace. Together, they represent the complete cycle of existence—the strength to act and the wisdom to reflect.

Each bracelet is finished with our signature Gold-Filled Sun Charm, serving as a golden thread that connects the energy of the sun and moon. Wear them stacked for a bold, balanced statement, or share one with a "soul-half" who complements your energy.

gone.name: Elemental Alignment: The Infinite Octave
gone.desc:
The ultimate manifestation of light, energy, and balance. The Celestial Quintessence is our most prestigious reward, featuring the entire five-piece collection: Solace Clarity (Clear Quartz), Oceanic Solace (Aquamarine), Eternal Noon (Sunstone), Echoes of Daylight (Moonstone), and Amethyst Aura (Amethyst).

This collection is curated for the soulful collector who recognizes the interconnectedness of all things. Whether you stack them together to create a stunning, multi-tonal statement or rotate them daily to align with your changing energy, this set offers a complete spiritual toolkit. Every bracelet is unified by our signature Gold-Filled Sun Charm, symbolizing that while the stones’ energies vary, they are all bound by the same universal light.

project.name: The Runes Collection — One-of-a-Kind Silver Jewelry
project.description: A limited collection of Sterling Silver 925 rune jewelry. Each piece is unique, inspired by ancient symbolism and reinterpreted

creator.name: THE 4 HARTS
creator.biography: The 4 Harts was created from a desire to design small symbolic jewelry collections that focus on meaning, individuality, and thoughtful design rather than mass production.

texte:
THE 4 HARTS  was born from a simple idea: jewelry should mean something.
Inspired by the ancient Norse runic alphabet of the Elder Futhark, timeless symbols, and modern minimalism, we create pieces that are more than accessories — they are daily reminders of strength, intention, and personal growth.

The 4 Harts takes its name from the four red stags (harts) of Norse mythology — the stags that stand beside Yggdrasil, the great tree of life.
They symbolize connection, balance, and the quiet strength that links all worlds.
Each piece is designed to act as a personal talisman: a quiet source of confidence, protection, and energy that accompanies you through everyday life.
At The 4 Harts, we believe jewellery can carry stories, intention, and power — helping you stay connected to who you are and who you are becoming.

Each reward corresponds to one jewelry piece from the collection, as shown in the reward images.
After the campaign, you will select your preferred symbol and design through a backer survey.

All pieces are already made.
Shipping will begin shortly after the campaign ends.

As a mother and founder, I’ve built The 4 Harts around a simple belief: meaningful objects should carry intention and individuality, not mass production.
This project reflects that philosophy — small symbolic collections designed to feel personal and unique.

project.name: AntiSocial ★ Caring is Punk! Streetwear Drop Spring '26
project.description: A capsule streetwear collection.

creator.name: Emily Ree
creator.biography: Comic artist, writer, and fashion designer.

titre: Pick your vibe, dream your dream~
texte: Caring is Punk! is a streetwear brand by Emily Ree.
Through this campaign, I'm looking to fund the third Caring is Punk capsule wardrobe drop. And this one is bigger than ever!
The 2026 drop features t-shirts, a jacket, commemorative prints, and more.
This drop has three distinct vibes. Which one are you?
Inspired by my AntiSocial Dreamer sticker sheet, this drop has a t shirt and a jacket. The monogram is printed on the front and the main illustration is printed on the back.
Based off of my New Years 2026 illustration, this drop has a t-shirt in 2 colorways. The special cat monogram is printed on the front and the main illustration is printed on the back.
Inspired by the 2026 Caring is Punk patch, this drop has a raglan 3/4 sleeve shirt, available in unisex or "ladies" fitted. The monogram is printed on the front, the back is blank.
Post Card Mini Prints
a set of post card mini prints, featuring the key art from each drop and some throwbacks.
Patch
A 3 inch by 2.5 inch iron-on patch of Cara, the Caring is Punk mascot!
Skateboard Deck
Super limited drop of punk nose AntiSocial Skateboard Decks! Perfect for display or skating, whatever you like.
Cara Heart Hats
A beanie and a dad cap, featuring Cara that Caring is Punk heart mascot.
Inspired by bodega bags, the Spring 2024 shirt is a warm cream color with red print.
It's important to me to make my products as locally as I can. From Woodstock to Brooklyn, I'm proud to say that Caring is Punk apparel and accessories are made in New York.

Hi! I'm Emily Ree. If we've never met before, I'm a cartoonist and fashion designer from New York. I have over a dozen successful Kickstarter campaigns under my belt, mostly for graphic novels and zines! I've been working on Caring is Punk pieces since 2018, but I officially launched the brand in 2023. This is my second Caring is Punk! campaign.

I am a graduate of the Fashion Institute of Technology in New York City. Though this is only my third official Caring is Punk drop, I am an experienced creator, merchandiser, and vendor. You can see more of my work on my Instagram and on my website.
I'm so pleased to share this capsule collection with you. I hope you'll consider backing the project and wear your Caring is Punk merch with pride!

project.name: Pinhole: A New Thriller Film by Derrick Acosta
project.description: A story of suspense and hidden identities

creator.name: Derrick Acosta
creator.biography:
Co-founder of Mega64. Filmmaker, YouTuber, Video Director/Writer/Producer and Actor.

As co-creator of the production company Mega64, Derrick has produced videos for MTV, Shepard Fairy, Nintendo, Hasbro, SpikeTV, Sony, Game Developers Conference, The Hub Network, Disney, Microsoft and more.

As a music video director he's worked for Cult Records, Swami Records, Finn Records, Thrill Me Records, Cheddar Goblin and others. 

As an actor he's appeared in commercials, television, web and film. Including featured roles on Spike TV's Game Trailers TV and The Aquabats Super Show on the HUB.

Derrick currently resides in San Diego, CA. producing weekly entertainment for his YouTube channel, Mega64, with a video catalog garnering over 200 million views and 600K+ subscribers worldwide.

texte: Latest campaign updates and milestones:
February 20th - Pinhole is 50% funded!

By picking the pledge that best fits your level of support, you can help bring PINHOLE into the world. Every reward tier is designed to either bring you closer to the film—or bring the film closer to you.
Please take a moment to see what reward tier is best for you.
REMINDER: Every tier level includes the rewards from lower tiers.
$5 street team: Thank you Email + Backer Updates + ways to help spread the word

$15 Supporter: Thank you + Backer Updates + A curated watch list of films that inspired PINHOLE, with short notes from Derrick.$20 Digital Premiere (Most Popular) - EARLY BIRD SPECIAL - ONLY AVAILABLE FOR FIRST 24 HOURS: Digital download of PINHOLE upon release  + BTS featurette + Your name listed on THANK YOU Page of Films website
$25 Digital Premiere (Most Popular): Digital download of PINHOLE upon release  + BTS featurette + Your name listed on THANK YOU Page of Films website
$45 Digital Deluxe: Digital Download Link + BTS Featurette + Commentary Track + PDF of Screenplay
$55 Physical Edition (Best Value) - EARLY BIRD SPECIAL - ONLY AVAILABLE FOR FIRST 24 HOURS: Digital + Physical Blu-Ray or DVD + BTS Feature + Commentary Track + Signed Lobby Card
$65 Physical Edition (Best Value): Digital + Physical Blu-Ray or DVD + BTS Feature + Commentary Track + Signed Lobby Card
$100 Limited Edition Backer: Everything Above + Signed Limited Edition Art Print + Name featured in credits of the film
$350 Red Carpet Experience: The Limited Edition Backer Tier + Guaranteed premiere screening + two (2) tickets to the red carpet premiere of the film (Travel / Lodging NOT included)
$500 Associate Producer: Red Carpet Experience Tier + Name in Credits as Associate Producer + 20 minute creative call with director
NOTE: Some higher tiers offer different ways to participate — either on-screen or behind the scenes. Backers at those levels can choose the experience that fits them best.
For Tier 9, you can select OPTION 1...

$1000 Walk on Role (LIMIT 4): Featured extra or walk-on appearance in the film + Film Credit + Blu-Ray Copy of film + Invitation to Premier (Travel / Lodging NOT included) [You’ll also receive a still frame from your scene for personal use.] Non-principal role. Dialogue not guaranteed. Must be available as a local hire.
Or you can select OPTION 2...

$1000 Producer: Red Carpet Experience + Producer Credit in the film + Blu-Ray Copy of film + Early Access / Festival run Digital Screener link. + Dinner with Film Makers (if feasible - Travel/Lodging not included)
$5000 Executive Producer: Producer Tier + Festival Access (Invitation to Festival Screenings) + Involvement in release conversations.
Investment opportunities are available. Please visit www.DerrickAcosta.com for contact information.

project.name: Game On: A Feature Documentary about Brenda Romero
project.description: Help Theresa Loong finish her documentary about Brenda Romero: visionary designer and mentor, shaping the future of game creation!

creator.name: Theresa Loong
creator.biography: Theresa Loong is a NYC director/producer working in film, games, and interactive media. She is directing "Game On" about trailblazing game designer Brenda Romero. She also directed "Building Stuff: Change It!" for PBS/NOVA and "Every Day Is a Holiday", which premiered on public television and screened at the Asia Society and National Gallery of Art. Theresa has made 15 + games.

texte: Welcome to Game On, a documentary celebrating the extraordinary career of pioneering game designer Brenda Romero, directed by the visionary Theresa Loong. Brenda’s work has shaped the game industry for decades, yet her story represents something even bigger than games: it’s about daring to build worlds when the real one doesn’t always make space for you.

Through Theresa’s lens, we explore not just a remarkable career, but the heart, humor, and humanity behind it. Game On is joyful, thoughtful, and fiercely inspiring, just like the woman at its center. Women filmmakers and women game developers have often been the hidden architects of our stories and our play. When we celebrate women who design our games and women who direct our films, we expand who gets to imagine, who gets to lead, and who gets to be remembered.

The documentary is so close to the finish line! We need your help to complete post-production and jumpstart distribution and impact campaigns to bring Game On to the world. With your support, we can ensure this powerful story is told with the care, craft, and celebration it deserves. Thanks for being here. Let’s level up together!

For pioneering game designer Brenda Romero (Dungeons & Dragons, Wizardry 8, and 45+ more), life is one big game space! Game On delves into Brenda’s process as she creates must-play titles, inspires youth, and nurtures a global fan base by turning home life and personal challenges into games.

Brenda incorporates game play into every aspect of her life. She treats the board and video games she creates as an opportunity to both entertain players and amplify important social issues. Her games explore cultural histories including Black, Indigenous, Irish, Mexican and Jewish, in ways that challenge us.

Game On follows Brenda’s life as the CEO of her video game company, Romero Games, and as a mom. She and her husband, legendary game developer John Romero, are on a mission to do what they love while raising four kids in an ethnically-blended family. Brenda helms the production of a new game, and opens up a timely discussion about sexism in the gaming world.

First, your dollars will go directly to paying our crew, finishing the edit and mixing the sound. Remaining funds will help with distribution and awareness.

Second, you’re fueling impact and outreach to make games more accessible for all. We’re planning hands-on game design workshops and educational events that carry the spirit of the Game On into schools, communities, and creative spaces.

With your help, we’re not just completing a documentary, we’re launching something that inspires lasting change!

Game On has partnered with Games for Change, a nonprofit organization providing support to individuals and organizations using serious games for social change. We are educating youth around the world about the power of games and helping them explore career paths. We worked with Games for Change and high school students from New York City at the Microsoft Experience Center in NYC.

Additional Outreach Partners are Immigrant Social Services and Women in Games International (WIGI). We’ve prototyped workshops in Chinatown, Governors Island, and the Lower East Side. With your help, will expand workshops nationwide and internationally! 

Feedback from our students: "it's mad lit all you do is play games, might as well learn to build your own game!” “[My favorite part was] seeing the participants' game ideas and meeting the ﬁlmmaker.”

Theresa continues to present Game On at conferences to raise awareness about how film and games can inspire future designers to create serious and entertaining games. One story makes a difference. Through our strategic approach to community partnerships, outreach and engagement, Game On reaches an international audience, contributing to positive changes in the world of video games and STEM. Our goal is to impact 10,000 youth to create meaningful games and find jobs in game and game-adjacent industries.

Theresa Loong is an award-winning director, producer, game creator, and immersive storyteller whose work lives at the intersection of play, human connection, and transformation. Working across documentary film, interactive media, and augmented, virtual, and mixed reality (AR/VR/MR), she crafts stories that don’t just inform, they invite audiences in.

Her documentary Every Day Is a Holiday premiered on public television and screened at venues including the Asia Society Hong Kong and the National Gallery of Art, as well as the Montclair and Black Maria Film Festivals. As a producer, Theresa has created ten games, including interactive experiences for AMC’s The Walking Dead and Breaking Bad. She co-created Feed Me a Story, which brings families together to share memories and recipes, and is directing Bought/Broken, a VR project highlighting intimate partner violence.

Theresa has received grants from the National Endowment for the Arts and the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council. She was an artist-in-residence at the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island National Monuments, a Flaherty Film Seminar Fellow, and has exhibited work at the Brooklyn Museum, Triennale di Milano, Círculo de Bellas Artes, and on Governors Island. She has mentored teams at POV Interactive and produced Farmers for America, which debuted on public television. She serves as chairperson of the non-profit film collective Filmshop (NY/New Orleans/LA) and as a trustee of the Thomas Edison Media Arts Consortium.

A graduate of Harvard University with an MFA from Hunter College, Theresa teaches part-time at Parsons and Vassar. In the experience design realm, she has collaborated with museums, companies, and artists, including Kaki King, Jonah Bokaer, the New York Hall of Science, the Tech Museum of Innovation, and Smithsonian Channel, to create interactive works for children and adults alike.

Across all of her work, both behind the camera and designing participatory experiences, Theresa is guided by one core belief: that play is powerful. It can open hearts, shift perspectives, and bring people together in unexpected ways.

project.name: THE 9 LIVES OF BARBARA DANE: PBS Broadcast & Soundtrack CD
project.description: Help Us Prepare This Award-Winning Film for Broadcast Nationally and Internationally!

creator.name: Jed Riffe
creator.biography:
Jed Riffe is a national Emmy nominated film producer, director and interactive storyteller. Over the last thirty-five years Riffe has produced eighteen nationally and internationally broadcast public television specials including a four-hour TV series, two theatrically released documentaries and four major interactive media installations.

Riffe is best known as producer/director of these award-winning films: ISHI, THE LAST YAHI-The American Experience; WHO OWNS THE PAST?-Independent Lens; WAITING TO INHALE: MARIJUANA, MEDICINE AND THE LAW-Independent Lens and CALIFORNIA’S ‘LOST’ TRIBES- CALIFORNIA AND THE AMERICAN DREAM PBS series.

Most recently, Riffe produced the feature length documentaries THE ASH GROVE, FROM HERE / FROM THERE, THE 9 LIVES OF BARBARA DANE, PLEISTOCENE PARK, THE LONG SHADOW and A DANGEROUS IDEA: EUGENICS, GENETICS AND THE AMERICAN DREAM. He served as series producer of the CALIFORNIA AND THE AMERICAN DREAM PBS series including producing RIPE FOR CHANGE and CALIFORNIA’S ‘LOST’ TRIBES.  He co-produced the documentaries ANDRE, THE VOICE OF WINE and ONE VOICE, and executive produced: SMOKIN’ FISH; A NEW COLOR: THE ART OF BEING EDYTHE BOONE; and TO CHRIS MARKER, AN UNSENT LETTER.  He served as the post producer/supervisor of IS YOUR STORY MAKING YOU SICK? He is currently serving as impact producer on AMERICAN SONS.

Early on in his film career Riffe developed an interest in interactive storytelling. He wanted to reach new audiences with engaging short video content that could be accessed by users in a non-linear fashion on multiple platforms.  Most recently Riffe produced and project managed the AFRICANA AND THE DIASPORA, an Interactive program which includes 6 hours of topic driven videos that Riffe produced and directed; he served as interactive producer/writer for the design of four interactive exhibits for the Autry Museum of American History; he was interactive producer and writer for the award-winning PUBLIC BROADCASTING IN PUBLIC PLACES; he wrote, produced and directed TV OF TOMORROW for CPB; and he produced 68 videos for three interactive History Information Stations, at the Oakland Museum of California History. 

Riffe’s films has won over 50 national and international film festival awards. He is the recipient of multiple grants and contracts from the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, PBS, the Ford Foundation, Sundance Documentary Fund and five National Endowment for the Humanities scripting and production grants including the prestigious NEH Chairman's Discretionary Award, and 59 grants from state humanities councils.

Riffe is honored to be both a Sundance Documentary Film Program Fellow/Alumni, and a Gerbode Fellow for Excellence in Non-Profit Management.

texte: Pete Seeger mentored her, Bob Dylan called her a “hero”, Louis Armstrong discovered her, Jane Fonda called her an inspiration. Singer, activist, mother, feminist, record producer, maverick and general troublemaker, Barbara Dane turns setbacks into opportunities, paving her own way with her art, participating in and influencing international social justice and musical movements across nine decades.

Many of YOU joined us in 2023 when we launched a successful Kickstarter campaign to pay for the music rights so we could release a feature length version of our award-winning film THE 9 LIVES OF BARBARA DANE.  That film has been released, as many of you know, to great acclaim. It also opened up a NEW opportunity, so we're asking for modest new support to fans of Barbara Dane to help us again.

Pledges to THIS campaign will fund the preparation of the feature length version down to a required 56:46 minutes for NATIONAL BROADCAST ON PBS and also an hour-long version for international broadcast on public television stations around the world. We're excited that this film has gotten these offers, and we thank you. The work to be done will include a new sound mix, title graphics, captioning and added music licenses for the international version. Additionally, we're working on producing a Soundtrack CD and DVD of the film.

We project we need to raise at least $20,000 via this Kickstarter campaign to cover these costs. This is where you come in! We are excited and energized about the film's new opportunities and look forward to advancing it expeditiously with YOUR SUPPORT!
CHECK OUT OUR GREAT REWARDS ON THE RIGHT SIDE!

IN HONOR OF BARBARA AND NINA: Since our first campaign for this film, we lost Barbara and we are honoring her memory. Barbara Dane passed in October 2024, at the age of 97. Her daughter, our indefatigable film partner and Executive Producer, Nina Menéndez, after a lengthy and courageous battle with cancer, passed in August 2025.

Thankfully, Nina and Barbara were able to share in some of the film’s success with us. To have the opportunity to share Barbara's story in preparing for nationwide PBS and International broadcasts, is an honor for us, and a tribute to her and to Nina.
NINA MENENDEZ (1956 – 2025) and BARBARA DANE (1927 - 2024)
American history gets a shakeup through the story of Barbara Dane, a powerhouse blues, jazz, folk singer and activist.

THE 9 LIVES OF BARBARA DANE reveals the untold story of an often-overlooked artist whose dedication to music and social justice showcases the tireless spirit and spirit at the heart of American activism, from the 1960s to today.

Mentored by Pete Seeger, discovered by Louis Armstrong, with Bob Dylan bringing his songs to her and Bonnie Raitt drawing inspiration from her work, Dane stood at the center of major cultural movements. She launched the career of the Chambers Brothers and helped shape Jane Fonda’s politics, raising a compelling question: Why isn’t Barbara Dane a household name?
Photo by Irene Young

The film chronicles a trailblazing woman who chose conscience over fame, transforming setbacks into opportunities and forging her own path through art. With singular confidence, Dane emanated the people-powered connectivity of folk, the defiance of blues, and the elemental cool of jazz - using music as a force for change and earning a four-inch FBI file along the way.
Check out the film's Trailer
“Must see!” — Pam Grady, SF CHRONICLE

“THE 9 LIVES OF BARBARA DANE is superb – a striking film…Anything but another formulaic music doc. 9 LIVES is the real deal!”  — Garth Cartwright (THE GUARDIAN) “Yakety Yak: Homage to an American Hero”
“(Dane's) life is staggering, and Gosling presents it in a ravishing cascade of imagery and music, Dane’s soulful, velvety voice floating above it all.” — Bernard Boo, MARIN MAGAZINE
“(A) lovable renegade, captured with great authenticity and breathtaking performances.” — Randy Myers, PIEDMONT EXEDRA
"Salt Springers loved, loved, LOVED your film. People couldn’t stop talking about it!" —Salt Springs Film Festival programmer; AUDIENCE AWARD FOR BEST MUSIC FILM
Check out whereTHE 9 LIVES OF BARBARA DANE has screened around the world!

We at Protesta Productions - Director Maureen Gosling and Producer Jed Riffe - are thrilled that our film is getting out into the world. The film has been in film festivals, in theaters, art houses and performing arts centers - across the United States, Japan, Germany, England, Canada, Italy, Mexico and Brazil. NOW, with your support, we can bring it to television audiences around the world.

The film had its World Premiere at the Mill Valley Film Festival, with two sold-out shows and accompanying sold-out concert, with Pablo Menéndez, Holly Near, Willie Chambers, Jesse Cahn, Osamu Menéndez and more. It has earned Best Feature Documentary awards at Julien Dubuque International Film Festival, Vermont Film and Folklore Film Festival, Eastern Oregon Film Festival; Audience Award for Best Music Documentary at Salt Springs Film Festival; and Best Director, Documentary Feature at the Indie Las Vegas International Film Festival.

In a number of places, we have had Women’s Rebel Voices Film and Music Tour events, where talented women singers have performed along with the film and joined us in the Q & A’s to talk about their own music of conscience. These conversations and  live performances have added depth and value to the film experience, reinforcing the connection between the film’s message and the music it celebrates.
Eljuri – at the Roxy Cinema in NYC, as part of Women’s Rebel Voices at Doc’n Roll Film Festival
Barbara Dane sitting in with the Muddy Waters Band in Chicago late 1950s

“I'M ON MY WAY” EP VINYL ($20) - New re-issue by Gregmark Records of Barbara's iconic song, "I'm On My Way" EP vinyl. A hit in 1960's when it was released and still a hit today in the US and the underground Northern Soul Movement in the UK!

NEW! SOUNDTRACK ALBUM OF THE 9 LIVES OF BARBARA DANE ($35) We are thrilled to offer the soon-to-be-launched Soundtrack of 15+ songs from the film, many of which have never been released before. It's a chance to hear the complete versions of songs!

THE 9 LIVES OF BARBARA DANE Poster ($40) - Mock-up below left. Includes secret scene video link and digital download of the film. Poster is hand-signed by Director/Editor Maureen Gosling and Producer Jed Riffe.
