COMBO #1 ($95) - Any two of the The 9 Lives of Barbara Dane T-Shirt, The 9 Lives of Barbara Dane poster signed by Jed and Maureen, or "I'm On My Way" limited edition digital album (streaming & download) PLUS the secret scene video link and digital download of the film.

COMBO #2 ($125) - All three The 9 Lives of Barbara Dane T-Shirt, The 9 Lives of Barbara Dane poster signed by Jed and Maureen, or "I'm On My Way" EP vinyl, including a “Gippergate Blues” vinyl PLUS the secret scene video link, and digital download of the film.

ZOOM PACKAGE ($300) - join the Team for a fascinating Zoom call - featuring the filmmaker(s) A true INSIDER reward. Includes a copy of This Bell Still Rings, Barbara's autobiography. PLUS the secret scene video link, and digital download of the film.

As you’ll see in THE 9 LIVES OF BARBARA DANE film, Barbara made history as the first American performer to break the U.S. embargo with Cuba. In 1966, she and Julius Lester were the only protest singers who showed up from more than 50 artists from the U.S. and Canada invited to the Encuentro de la canción protesta—an international gathering of activist musicians, many from authoritarian countries across Central and South America.

Fifty years later, in 2016, the filmmakers returned to Cuba with Barbara, her daughter and manager Nina Menéndez, pianist Tammy Hall, bassist Ruth Davies, and joined by Barbara’s son Pablo Menéndez and his Cuban-born son Osamu Menéndez. Together, they performed at Casa de las Américas, marking the 50th anniversary of Barbara’s original appearance there. Filmed by Cuban cinematographer Roberto Chile, these moments are central to telling Barbara’s extraordinary story of music, courage, and lifelong activism.

Over decades of travel to Cuba—performing, attending film festivals, and visiting Pablo and Osamu—Barbara and Maureen collected the Vintage Cuban Film Posters we’re now offering as Kickstarter rewards. Each one is a tangible piece of the cultural exchange, artistic resistance, and shared history that this film celebrates:

... through The Arhoolie Foundation, a 501c3 nonprofit organization whose mission is the documentation, preservation, and celebration of regional roots music and its makers -- pledges made to this campaign are tax-deductible, to the amount and extent allowable by law. The Foundation was created by the late Arhoolie Records roots music producer, Chris Strachwitz and continues his legacy. The Foundation has been the prime nonprofit sponsor of the film.

By its activities, the Arhoolie Foundation seeks to broaden public awareness of our diverse music history, support the vitality of living traditions, and reinforce the value and sustainability of community-based cultures." NOTE: Barbara Dane was a good friend of Chris Strachwitz, even before he began his record label back in the late '60s. He recorded an album with Barbara and Lightnin' Hopkins, "Sometimes I Believe She Loves Me" and her caustic and amusing song, "Gippergate Blues." Maureen was also a good friend of Strachwitz.

“Because I have chosen to live my life against the grain, loving our still imperfect Constitution too much to believe in the tropes of professional patriots; because I reject the idea that any nation is ‘number one’; because I admit to either all gods or none; because my idea of being a woman does not include big hair and plastic tits, tight dresses and dangerous shoes; because I can’t bend low enough to kiss asses; because of all this and more, I’ve arrived at my old age with a clean conscience.” — Barbara Dane

“Barbara Dane was a kindred spirit. Directing this film about her brought together my passions for music, peace, social justice, and amplifying the voices of women. THE 9 LIVES OF BARBARA DANE called on me to dip into my own now vast experiences in life and filmmaking.

“My latest film combines musical performance, history, politics, and an unheralded woman all in one remarkable story. It was a daring creative choice to go on the road and film an 89-year-old woman with limited mobility. Barbara was always present, focusing on what is happening now, always drawing on her past experiences and sharing generously with those around her.
Barbara Dane at Yoshi’s Jazz Club, Oakland

“Recent political events have energized millions of people to take to the streets to support defense of democracy, women’s rights, movements for Black and Brown lives, and the climate crisis. Many activists and music enthusiasts are unfamiliar with Barbara Dane, a force for change in this country who, even as a white woman in the 1950s, was boldly intersectional and so potent in her power that she was intentionally obscured from public discourse. I believe Barbara’s example will inspire people to let go of fears and doubts, find community, and get involved in social change. My goal for the film is to increase  awareness of her contributions, magnify her impact and smash stereotypes of what women have been, are, and can be as artists and social activists. I want the public to know Barbara Dane so that they may feel empowered to take action in their own way, just as she did. That change can take time, but it is worth it. And you just keep going.”
Cinematographer Roberto Chile & Director Maureen Gosling on location in Cuba
EXECUTIVE PRODUCERS:  DANNY GLOVER  JONATHAN LOGAN   CAROLYN MUGAR   KIT MILLER    D.D. WIGLEY    T.M. SCRUGGS    NANCY BLACHMAN

MAUREEN GOSLING, DIRECTOR AND EDITOR: Maureen Gosling has been a documentary filmmaker since 1972. She has worked as director, producer, editor, sound recordist and distributor. Producer/Director credits include the feature doc THIS AIN’T NO MOUSE MUSIC! (premiered SXSW), with Chris Simon, on the life and legacy of American roots music record producer, Chris Strachwitz; and the feature doc BLOSSOMS OF FIRE, on the Isthmus Zapotecs of Oaxaca, Mexico (Coral Award: Havana Int’l FF). Gosling edited PLEISTOCENE PARK (VICE); THE LONG SHADOW (PBS); A NEW COLOR (PBS) and many other docs. She is best known for her 20-year collaboration (as co-filmmaker, editor, sound recordist) with the late Les Blank on more than 20 films, including BURDEN OF DREAMS (BAFTA Award for Best Documentary 1982). For the last 20 years, she has worked with Jed Riffe on nine films, including CALIFORNIA’S “LOST” TRIBES, of the PBS series CALIFORNIA AND THE AMERICAN DREAM. Gosling is a member of the Academy of Motion Picture, Arts and Sciences. Maureen's Wikipedia Page

JED RIFFE, PRODUCER:  Jed Riffe has 36  years of experience producing films, TV and interactive programming for national and international broadcast, limited theatrical exhibition, streaming and VOD. Riffe produced and directed these award-winning PBS documentaries:  ISHI, THE LAST YAHI;  WHO OWNS THE PAST?; WAITING TO INHALE and CALIFORNIA’S” LOST” TRIBES. Riffe produced: FROM HERE / FROM THERE; RIPE FOR CHANGE; A DANGEROUS IDEA; THE LONG SHADOW, among other docs. As Series Producer, Riffe raised $2,000,000 for the 4 part/hour, independently produced, nationally broadcast PBS series, CALIFORNIA AND THE AMERICAN DREAM and its ancillary products. His films have received 50 awards at national and international film festivals. Riffe is a Sundance Documentary Film Program Fellow/ Alumni and a Gerbode Fellow for Excellence in Non-Profit Management.

NINA MENÉNDEZ, EXECUTIVE PRODUCER:  Menéndez received her PhD in Latin American and Spanish Cultural Studies from Stanford University. She produced the documentary, TROPICOLA; was the Founder and Artistic Director of the Bay Area Flamenco Festival; was Executive Director of the Barbara Dane Legacy Project, which houses Dane’s multimedia collection and began working on digitizing and cataloging over 150 unreleased audio tapes. Additional initiatives of the BDLP include releasing a box set of Dane’s recordings on the Smithsonian label; publishing Dane’s memoir, THIS BELL STILL RINGS, MY LIFE OF DEFIANCE AND SONG; producing six concerts celebrating Dane’s 90th birthday; and producing this film. Dr. Menéndez was Ms. Dane’s daughter. IN MEMORIAM.

ASHLEY JAMES, CINEMATOGRAPHER: James has been a Cinematographer on dozens of docs. He was Director/ Cinematographer of BOMBA: DANCING THE DRUM, AND STILL WE DANCE, and AMERICAN TREASURE, all broadcast on PBS. He was Producer and Director of Photography of the new film, SANTOS: SKIN TO SKIN. James is Co-founder, with Kathryn Golden, of Searchlight Films. His docs have earned five CINE Golden Eagles, two Telly awards, and three Pegasus awards for excellence in television programming He was past governor at the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences, Northern California chapter.

SIANEY MONTES DE OCA, GRAPICS & ANIMATION:  Montes de Oca, originally from Mexico City and currently based in L.A, specializes in broadcast and film communication design. She has managed projects from conceptual development to production for organizations such as R/GA, Brand New School, Imaginary Forces, Taylor James, Edisen, mOcean and The Wall Street Journal. She was the Title Designer and Animator for the documentary film COLETTE, an Academy Award Winner for Best Documentary Short Subject directed by Anthony Giacchino.

project.name: SCP:GALLIONIC
project.description: An animated short set in the SCP universe following a breach and the effects it has on two siblings working within.

creator.name: SOEM STUDIOS
creator.biography: Small studio made by Brando Leon Rustici and Mikey Nowack, currently working on SCP:GALLIONIC

titre: HOW YOUR MONEY WILL BE SPENT
texte: SCP:GALLIONIC is an independent animated short film following the events after a catastrophic containment breach through the eyes of Matthew Vestergaard, a simple accountant working on the outskirts of the facility, and the events leading up to said breach through Jane Vestergaard, a young researcher at the facility and Matthew’s older sister. Jane is helplessly frustrated with the facility's status quo in which containment breaches seem to be a common occurrence and the loss of staff is just part of the job. She is worried this mass apathy could lead to a catastrophic containment breach and has to scramble for a solution to all of this. Matthew, on the other hand, decides to venture within the facility after said catastrophic event, with no knowledge of what happened or even what is in this place, but with the sole goal of saving his sister.

The story explores theme of control over one's surroundings and selves. Whilst the story is based on various lore from the  SCP wiki, it is not necessary to have any prior knowledge of it to fully enjoy this short. If anything we hope this short gets more people curious about SCP and all that it brings!

Working in the outskirts of the main facility as a simple accountant, Matthew passes his days in relative tranquillity, not having to bear the knowledge of what is kept within the facility. His attitude however suddenly changes when a catastrophic containment breach occurs at the site, and he together with the few who were outside of the facility are left without any information of what happened. With rescue being unavailable and the threat of the whole place self-destructing, Matthew decides to venture into the facility and find his sister, despite knowing the near impossibility of the task.

As a young 29 year old researcher at site 19-2, Jane, like many others, is tasked with the observation and research of various anomalies contained within the facility. As time goes on, she witnesses multiple breaches, in which anomalies escape containment, wreaking havoc within the site and leaving many casualties. However, what shocks her the most are not the breaches in it of themselves, but everyone's seeming apathy towards them. She worries that this will lead to complacency, and sooner or later, a catastrophic breach, which could put in serious risk the entire site, if not the world at large. Therefore she desperately starts searching for a possible solution to all of this before it's too late.

Virgil is a senior facility guard working on the facility's perimeter who's only job is that of making sure nothing enters the site. Despite having worked within the facility in his early days, he quickly realised he'd much prefer a calmer albeit more boring position outside, as a patrol officer. However, when finding out his friend, Matthew, was going to enter the facility alone after The catastrophic containment breach, he decides to accompany him and become his guide through the maze like structure, aiding him in finding his sister, despite knowing the risks, and that they might never come back.

Jessica is a senior researcher at site 19-2 with multiple years of experience and a discrete level of authority within the site. Despite having seen many things over the years, she remains light-hearted and easy going, which seems to mesh well with Jane, as the two quickly become friends, helping out one another, leading to Jessica empathising with Jane’s sentiment, and deciding to help her in some shape or form.

Jake Walters  [@_JakeVA] as Matthew Vestergaard
Hunter Peterson  [@hitherehunter] as The Interviewer
Nola Klop   [@nolaklop] as Jane Vestergaard
Blythe Melin  [@blythemelin] as Virgil Castro
Cat Protano  [@catprotano] as Jessica Persik

As the biggest and most ambitious facility, Site 19-2 was built from the ground up in an undisclosed part of Alaska with the idea of containing as many anomalies in one single place as possible. When the idea for such a site was proposed to the board it was heavily criticised for its seeming danger, as one single catastrophic breach could put at risk many thousands of anomalies. However, through thorough testing and research, both in the architecture of the facility, together with its logistics and security systems, proved it near impossible for such an event to happen.

After such conclusion, what made the proposal even more appealing was the logistic and energy simplicity, as resources could be more easily concentrated in one single area instead of being spread out across multiple facilities, which made everything from resupplying to re-containment much easier.

The facility now houses over 100'000 active personnel, and one third of all actively containable non-indestructible SCPs, which means it is much closer to a city than a laboratory. Because of it's remote and hostile location, the foundation has taken extra steps in ensuring the wellbeing and comfort of all staff, so as to reduce any unwanted psychological stress and maintain maximum efficiency.
However, no system is perfect.

This project has been a long time coming. We've worked out the script, concept art, characters and even made a proof of concept trailer, but we now want to take it a step further, and make this project become a reality.

We are extremely passionate about animation. It also happens to be that we are big SCP fans. It was thanks to these elements that we are where we are today. We want to put to good use our abilities and passions so as to create something worthy of everyone's time. To say we put our hearts and souls into this would be an understatement. That's why we came to Kickstarter: we want to deliver the best of the best, and for that we need resources to compensate everyone who's helping us on this endeavour, whilst also retaining artistic freedom as we don't have to rely on external third party producers.

We want to be as transparent as possible during this production, sharing our workflow, some materials, and more with the whole community. As a backer you'll be able to closely follow the production and see the inner workings, from animation, background creation, voice acting, and so on.
How can you help us?

CONTRIBUTE 💵If you are in a position that allows it, backing this campaign would mean getting it ever so closer to the final goal! Backers get cool rewards and behind the scenes too, so I think that's also pretty cool.
ENGAGE 👇 for this project to work we must break the internet, so share, comment and make this go viral!

SHARE ➡️ let everyone know about this project, whether they know of SCP or not! use the hashtag #SCPTheAnime or #SCPGLNC spread the word! Share your favourite moments from the trailer, observations you made (Easter-eggs you found) and let us know what you are most exited about!
Here is  the list of all the various tiers with their respective physical and digital rewards! Take a peak:
We want to thank VOGRACE for sponsoring our physical rewards!

They've been so kind to help us lower the costs for some of the rewards, making it so that we can dedicate more money towards the production and paying all our staff fairly! If you are looking for reliable, affordable and high quality gadgets for your projects absolutely check out VOGRACE!

Some rewards like the digital and physical art-book and various names in credits, will be fulfilled after the full short is completed, therefore those might take upwards of two years. In any case we'll keep you updated on the short's status, so make sure to follow us!
For all other rewards we project to have them delivered by Q4 of 2026, and some digital rewards like wallpapers should be available even sooner!
People with Art-books and credits will have those items delivered around Q3 of 2028 instead, but all your other rewards will be delivered in Q4 2026.

Shipping will be charged AFTER the campaign for all backers (except "Intruder" tier upwards). On average shipping for USA will be between $15-25, whilst international can vary from $20-30 (note that these are estimates and could vary slightly).

Please note that, because of certain EU regulations, we won't be able to accept payment for shipment from the following countries, and therefore won't be able to ship physical rewards to them: Russia, Belarus, Iran, North-Korea, Syria, Afghanistan, Libya, Myanmar, Haiti, Burundi, Democratic Republic of Congo, Guinea, Iraq, Somalia, Sudan, South-Sudan and Venezuela. Digital rewards are still available however.
It is your responsibility before donating to look up if your country can trade with Europe.
Prices do not include import taxes and will fall under the responsibility of the backer. Surveys will be sent out to backers upon conclusion of the campaign to confirm addresses and charge shipping.

You can check out here the concept for the various rewards! However, since designs still need to be finalised, we more than welcome audience feedback. See extra information for select products in the list below. If you have any remaining merch questions, refer to our FAQ or ask us a question via Kickstarter.
(These are all placeholders)
The money raised from this crowdfunding campaign will go towards a couple things like, production, making the cool rewards, and taxes / fees (RIP).
Here is a breakdown of where the funds will be going.
More money means cooler stuff! The more we have, the more we can invest right back into the project! So thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your support!
Here are some ideas we came up with, which you can do to help us out!
(Thanks to Studio Heartbreak for the inspiration with this one)

The short will be made by us, SOEM STUDIO, a small independent studio born when two friends obsessed with animation decided to team up and make  "something" together. Over the past three years we have worked on two small shorts, our first being SCP:PANIC and the other one being the trailer for SCP:GALLIONIC, slowly growing and improving, earning the trust of other animators and slowly building up enough confidence together with knowledge to hopefully develop a full animated short.

This trailer was made with the help of some of our friends who have worked with various animation studios which you might have heard of, like: '' Mappa Studio, Toei, Studio Pierrot, Studio Suncreature, Whitefox '' and on shows like '' One Piece, Jujutsu Kaisen, Pokemon, HoyoFair 25, Dandadan, Mushoku Tensei '' and more.
Thank you for putting your trust in us.

project.name: Reality Resort: Trouble in Paradise (Episodes 12+13)
project.description: A character-driven, satirical animated series inspired by and lovingly paying homage to well-known competition shows.

creator.name: Cove
creator.biography: Dan (also known as Cove) is the creator of the animated web series "Reality Resort". For over a decade, he has passionately created content in the animated reality genre -- blending storytelling, competition, and character-driven drama into something uniquely his own. "Reality Resort" is the culmination of everything he loves about writing, animation, and building worlds for others to enjoy.

texte: 🏝️ Welcome to Reality Resort - a secluded island where 16 contestants face the ultimate test of wits, strength, and social strategy over 40 intense days. Alliances will form, betrayals will strike, and only one will emerge victorious to win the $250,000 prize.

This campaign is helping us bring Episodes 12 and 13 of Reality Resort to life - the next major chapter in the season’s story. If you’re new here, Episodes 1-11 are available to watch for free on YouTube. We highly recommend watching them before diving deeper! By backing this campaign, you’re helping us unlock the next part of the story and push the season forward. Scroll down to learn more about the episodes, backer rewards and more!

Reality Resort is an independently produced animated series that blends satire, drama, and competition, drawing inspiration from shows such as Big Brother, The Challenge and Total Drama Island. But unlike traditional reality TV, the story isn’t discovered in the edit. Every moment is written and designed intentionally, resulting in a show that's as entertaining as it is meaningful and as heartfelt as it is competitive.

The show uses the familiar framework of a reality competition gameshow - challenges, alliances and eliminations - as a lens for scripted and intentional storytelling, allowing us to build richer character arcs, sharper twists and emotional payoffs that feel both surprising and earned.

When you back Reality Resort, you're not just supporting indie animation - you're stepping into the game itself. Most rewards are digital, so your pledge goes straight into production while keeping things fast, flexible, and interactive.
($1) Tip Jar: A heartfelt thank you <3
($9) Supporter: Your name in the ending credits of each episode!
($19) Fan: includes Supporter rewards + customized character icon (pick one character, outfit and pose!)
($39) Intern: includes Fan rewards + 24 hour early access to Episodes 12+13 and digital assets package (backgrounds, props, graphics)
($59) Host: includes Intern rewards + digital episode package (annotated scripts, concept art, downloadable .mp4s)
($79) Contestant: includes Host rewards + bonus content package (animatics, eviction interviews, recap podcasts)
($129) Juror: includes Contestant rewards + exclusive t-shirt and your name read by the Narrator during the mid-roll ad!
($249) Finalist: includes Juror rewards + 48 hour early access to Episodes 12+13 and a 25-second animated greeting (pick one character and question)
($349) Champion: includes Finalist rewards + exclusive hoodie and your name read by the evicted tourist at the end of the episode!
($999) Producer [8 slots]: includes Champion rewards + Assistant Producer credit, a guaranteed Producer Token (see below) and help design a new outfit for a character!

($1,499) Executive [4 slots]: includes Producer rewards + Executive Producer credit, guaranteed Shoutout and Dedication Tokens (see below) and a one-on-one 30-minute call with Cove (creator of Reality Resort)!

($1,999) Legend [3 slots]: includes Executive rewards + two custom animated 30-second "Fan Interviews" featured directly in Episodes 12+13! (Design and voice your own original character as they are interviewed by Victoria, giving their take on the game in a special segment)

⭐️ For an additional $50, you can also upgrade your early access to 72 hours!
⭐️ To unlock the exclusive Reality Legend role in our Discord server, show proof of your pledge to a moderator!
⭐️ Take a peek at the exclusive t-shirt and hoodie below!

If you've backed one of our previous Kickstarters or are a current Patreon member, you may confirm this prior Kickstarter or Patreon support during the backer survey phase. Assuming the project is successful and you back at the Fan tier ($19) or higher, we will throw in the digital assets package at no extra charge. Additionally, we'll include official character renderings, official character outfits and official episode scripts just for you!

Ad revenue alone cannot sustain an animated series like Reality Resort. Between recent platform changes, shifting algorithms and reduced discoverability, YouTube has become increasingly unreliable for long-form, independent animation - especially at the scope and quality our audience expects. Crowdfunding allows us to keep the show free on YouTube while continuing to tell the story at our desired standard. At our current level of Patreon support, we’re able to fund roughly one episode per year. Kickstarter is what allows us to meaningfully accelerate production and keep the season moving.

The goal of this campaign is $15,000 which represents the bare minimum required to fully produce Episodes 12 and 13. This number does not include taxes - those are to be covered separately through ongoing Patreon support, allowing every dollar raised here to go directly into production.

To make this campaign viable, we’ve adjusted our episode runtimes to 22 minutes. This ensures we can continue producing new episodes and moving the story forward, even at minimum funding. However, these episodes were originally planned to be closer to 28 minutes each, which is where stretch goals come in.

For every $250 raised beyond the goal, one minute is added to each episode. This lets the audience directly support longer runtimes and helps us deliver Episodes 12 and 13 closer to the original vision, without risking the season’s completion. (Depending on the support, funds could potentially enable production on further episodes as well!)
Creating Reality Resort is a detailed, multi-step process. Here’s a generalized summary of how we break down the production timeline for each episode:

If funded, Episodes 12 and 13 will premiere on YouTube within 2-4 months after the campaign ends. We’re already working at full speed, but animation takes time, especially with limited resources. Here's our anticipated release schedule (dates are estimates and depend on funding and production progress. We cannot commit to specific release windows until further on in production):
Remember: the more funds we raise, the quicker we'll be able to finish the season. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we work hard to bring our vision to life!

Reality Resort is a labor of love created by a small, passionate, independent team and has largely been funded out of pocket up to this point. Kickstarter allows us to keep paying our artists, maintain quality and build a more sustainable workflow rather than rushing episodes or cutting corners.

Your support goes directly toward pre-production (storyboards, asset art) and post-production (layout, animation, music/sfx, editing) costs. We believe in being open about the realities of indie animation production, because this series is as much yours as it is ours. Together, we’re building something special!

🔘 Layout, Animation & Post-Production (55%)
The largest portion of your support goes directly into bringing each episode to life. This includes layout, animation, editing, music and sound effects; making sure everything looks and sounds as polished as it can be.

🔘 Storyboard & Asset Art (35%)
Every episode starts with detailed storyboards and asset creation. This includes designing outfits, props, backgrounds and creating all the individual illustrations needed for animation.

🔘 Kickstarter Fees (10%)
Kickstarter takes a small cut to cover platform and processing fees. Including this in the budget upfront ensures that the money you pledge goes where it matters most. (We did not include taxes in this section)

Another Legacy Idol is found and former adversaries find themselves working together, leading up to the next Immunity Competition, which sets the stage for the most chaotic Nomination Ceremony of the season. As relationships fall apart and new ones take shape, the lead-up to the Block Battle reveals just how much influence each nominee truly holds.

As the fallout from the previous Block Battle ripples through the resort, the next Immunity Competition forces players into an uncomfortable murder mystery where paranoia dominates the conversation. Confronted by the decisions they've made in and outside of this game, these nominees must survive the most daunting Block Battle yet.

The Reality Project began as a passion project from creator and showrunner Dan (Cove), who has spent over a decade immersed in both reality competition television and animation. What started as an experiment to merge the strategic intensity of reality TV with the creative control of scripted animation has grown into an independent studio focused on character-driven stories that feel fresh, intentional and emotionally grounded.

That vision led to Reality Resort -the first chapter in a larger, interconnected universe of competition-based stories. While each show is designed to stand on its own, they share a broader narrative ambition that extends beyond a single season or format. Finishing this first season of Reality Resort is a critical step toward realizing that long-term vision.

Since launching in July 2024, Reality Resort has grown steadily, building a passionate and engaged community. Across English and Spanish audiences, the series has almost 60,000+ YouTube subscribers, accumulated over 2.5 million views and fostered a 2,000+ member Discord community. Our social platforms total 10,000+ followers and Patreon includes over 2,000 supporters with around 100 actively backing the project financially.

This series has evolved alongside its audience. After initially partnering with another small animation studio, we transitioned to a fully in-house production pipeline starting with Episode 3, developing an animation style and workflow we’re proud of. With 11 full episodes released, The Reality Project is committed to pushing the boundaries of what independent animation can achieve - one episode, one season and one story at a time.

Reality Resort is created by a global, indie team of writers, voice actors, storyboard artists, designers, animators and post-production specialists - many of whom are working on their first major animated series, alongside others with professional studio experience.
This mix of fresh voices and seasoned talent allows us to combine ambition with care, ensuring the show continues to grow in both scope and quality while staying true to its roots.
Start the journey with Episode 1 here, all the way until Episode 11!
Watch the most recent episode here; Episode 11 - our first musical episode, which got glowing reviews!
You can also watch the first ten episodes here, in fewer videos which combine each block (every two episodes) and subsequent eviction.
Can't back right now? Please consider sharing our campaign with family, friends and fans! Follow us for updates and sneak peeks:
👉 Email us at therealityproject1@gmail.com with any inquiries.
We have some specific goals you can help us complete across social media! For each goal completed, some additional rewards will be unlocked for the campaign.

Your support fuels the future of indie animation and helps build a passionate, sustainable creative community. We deeply appreciate your trust and belief in Reality Resort, and we're committed to delivering a season you'll love!

project.name: Freddy Fazbear's Food and Theatre
project.description: A fan made, realistic found footage series based on the characters from the popular horror game: Five Night's At Freddy's.

creator.name: Tanner Young
creator.biography: I am a 3D animator/VFX artist working primarily in blender. My dream to create a show for adult swim, but my passion is human creativity. I will spend every second of my life sharing that with the world.

texte: Freddy Fazbear’s Food and Theatre is a realistic found footage horror series inspired by Five Nights at Freddy’s, originally created by Scott Cawthon. I’ve been a fan of that world for a long time, and this series is basically my attempt to present it in a way that feels like these places could actually exist in real life.

One of the biggest things I wanted to focus on was making the animatronics feel believable. I redesigned them from the ground up to resemble the types of stage robots that used to exist at places like Chuck E. Cheese and ShowBiz Pizza Place, while still keeping them completely original to this project. A lot of similar fan projects lean too heavily into copying those real world designs, and I really wanted to avoid that. I want these characters and this location to feel like their own thing while still feeling grounded and familiar.

Right now, my plan is to create AT LEAST four episodes, each somewhere around 5 to 15 minutes long. The series is going to be told through multiple points of view, with each character having a realistic reason for filming. I’m also rewriting the story and lore almost entirely from scratch. Some names and general ideas might carry over as inspiration, but this is meant to be its own story that doesn’t rely on knowledge of the original games. Due to  mystery being a large aspect of the story, I am unable to go in depth publicly with my exact plans for it, but do know I have 3 episodes fully scripted out and the overall narrative is no longer under development.

This campaign is mainly about helping me fully produce the series itself. The biggest goal is being able to create these episodes at a higher quality and in a more reliable timeframe.  The budget would be to make this series happen in the highest quality and most efficient way possible. Things like better hardware (a high fidelity gaming PC with 3D optimization in mind), blender add-ons (like auto-remesh and numerous environmental mods), as well as editing softwares that will ensure the series continues reliably and releases on time. Beyond that, I would like to give some bonuses to a few artists and voice actors who have volunteered to help me for free.

My production workflow usually starts with writing and planning out the story and camera perspectives. From there I move into modeling characters and environments, then animation and scene layout, followed by voice acting, sound design, rendering, and final editing. I create and animate everything inside Blender, and most models in the series are built by me, with some background assets coming from BlenderKit where appropriate.

As of now, the estimated production timeline starts with finishing scripts and major designs, then moving into full episode production which I expect to take several months depending on complexity. Episodes will be completed individually and released once they are finished. When production wraps, all episodes will be available publicly for free on my YouTube channel, BLOODLET_FX.

Backers would be supporting the actual creation of the series and would receive rewards tied directly to the production process, like early episode access, behind-the-scenes content, digital artwork, and credits in the series depending on the support tier. These rewards would be delivered alongside episode releases as production progresses.

Like any animated project, there are challenges that come with production time, rendering, learning new techniques, and coordinating with collaborators like voice actors or artists. To help manage this, I’m structuring production in stages and planning episodes in a way that lets progress continue even if certain parts take longer than expected.

This project is something I’m extremely passionate about because I’ve always believed the original concept works best when it feels grounded and believable. The goal is to create a horror series that feels like real discovered footage rather than just an animated retelling. Support from this campaign would help make that possible and help bring the full series to life.

project.name: The Virtue Saga One
project.description: Superhero films revolving around the theme of the Seven Virtues versus the Seven Deadly Sins.

creator.name: Yesha Productions
creator.biography: We are a team of student filmmakers who are passionate about film

titre: The Motivation: A Hero for the Next Generation
texte: I am currently raising funds for a superhero film series The Virtue Saga. This ambitious project consists of seven individual films, each exploring a unique dynamic between the seven virtues and the seven deadly sins. For example, the films will tackle themes like:
Humility vs. Pride
Patience vs. Wrath
Chastity vs. Lust
The goal is to provide a modern, superhero-themed spin on these deep theological concepts, making them accessible and engaging for a new generation.

This project is deeply personal to me. Like many others, I grew up looking up to iconic heroes like Spider-Man, Superman, and Batman. My mission is to create a new set of heroes for today's youth, specifically for audiences aged 13 and up. I want to provide them with characters who embody "pure good," serving as role models they can learn from and resonate with, just as I did as a child.
To bring this vision to life, the funds will be used in several key areas:

Supporting the Team: My top priority is ensuring the crew and actors are well-fed and supported. The production wouldn't be possible without their dedication, and I believe in prioritizing the well-being of the people behind the camera.

Crowdfunding and Community Support: We are actively seeking backers to help fund the production costs. By supporting this project early, you are investing in a story that will be shared with future generations.

My name is Rovir, the director of the first film and the producer behind this project, and I have been a dedicated filmmaker for the past three years. This film series is not just my project; it belongs to the entire crew and everyone who supports us. We are committed to showing you that with your help, we can create something truly impactful and something you will be proud to have supported.
If you'd like to learn more about the project or how to get involved, please feel free to ask!

project.name: Good Night Deborah
project.description: A family drama short film for Maine Mayhem 2026 filmed entirely on 16mm film

creator.name: Jordan Wells
creator.biography: I'm a writer and director based out of Southern Maine who aims to tell black stories on traditional mediums (16 and 35mm film)

texte: After months of hiding a respiratory illness from her husband, Arthur Wallace, Deborah Wallace crawls into bed and suffocates to death. Kevin Wallace, their son, is confirmed in his hatred for his father when he both doesn’t show up to her remembrance, and doesn’t honor her wishes of spreading her ashes. With the advent of a newborn baby, Kevin and his wife, Lilith, can’t spare any time not working, but Kevin has to reclaim his mother’s ashes. After abandoning Lilith to take care of the baby she didn’t want in the first place to meet with his father, Kevin has to decide whether it’s more important to him to take care of his family, or honor his mother’s wishes.

Good Night Deborah will be the first film in Maine Mayhem's 16 year history to be shot entirely on 16mm film, a rarity in today's digitally focused filmmaking landscape. This choice was made to emulate the feeling of a hazy memory of an argument with someone you care about.

The director of Good Night Deborah, Jordan Wells, recognizes the importance of highlighting black talent in film, so he has elected to focus on having an all-black cast as well as filming in locations that highlight the history of black Americans.

project.name: If She Only Knew
project.description: This film is a dream of mine, Im almost finished…final stages🙂 A small gift from you can make reeeally make this dream into a reality!

creator.name: Roxanne Wright
creator.biography: Roxanne Wright is a filmmaker and the CEO and Founder of Smirky Rox Productions. Her work is driven by a commitment to social impact, using film as a tool to inspire, educate, and promote positive change. Roxanne’s films focus on creating awareness, building self-confidence and self-esteem, and delivering powerful, message-driven storytelling. Her work has screened at film festivals around the world, earning recognition for its authenticity and emotional depth.

texte: I am currently raising funds to complete the final stages of my film, including the remaining edits and festival submission fees. As many know, film festival submissions can be costly, and this project means a great deal to me. It represents a long-held dream and a goal I am deeply committed to achieving.

I have dedicated significant time, energy, and passion to this film, and I am determined to see it completed and successfully shared with audiences. Your support will help bring this vision fully to life.
Teamwork makes the dream work and I truly cannot do it alone.

project.name: Luxe Tea: a global afternoon tearoom
project.description: A tearoom coming to Chicago that merges traditional afternoon tea service with tea rituals and food from a variety of global cultures.

creator.name: Luxe Tea
creator.biography: Luxe Tea is a developing tearoom that will explore and celebrate the world's tea traditions, merging them with the beloved pastime of afternoon tea.

titre: Why afternoon tea and why now?
What people are saying about us
texte: Celebrate tea traditions from all over the world at our global afternoon tearoom.  Luxe Tea will be an upscale tearoom that merges the familiar British afternoon tea service with traditions and global cuisines from a variety of countries with their own rich tea cultures.

Every week, there will be a rotating selection of menus to choose from, each highlighting breads, sweets, and savory bites from a different country.  Come back week after week to explore the world of tea!
Luxe Tea is perfect for people who love:

We're going to build an 80-seat tearoom in Chicago that will be a multi-sensory immersive space, whisking you away on a journey around the world.  You'll be able to enjoy afternoon tea service in our grand ballroom, or experience an authentic tea ceremony in one of our private rooms.
Restaurant industry reports show that today's diners are interested in:

Luxe Tea will provide all of this, and more.  I conducted a market research survey and 76% of survey takers said that they would attend afternoon tea.  Food and drink experiences were people's largest spending categories outside of their necessities, and the one area they would invest in the luxury category of.
Online, our followers say the same!
On top of all this, searches for afternoon tea are steadily rising on Google and social media.
Now that you know about Luxe Tea, here's a little more info about me and how I'm building this business.

Hi, I'm Tiara, founder of Luxe Tea.  I founded and operated a nonprofit for 7 years, led multiple organizations and workgroups, and managed six-figure federal grant budgets.  I use my background in scientific research to make data-driven decisions and my background as a creative to continuously innovate.  I'm also a champion for diversity and representation.  I'm excited to bring Luxe Tea to life with your support!
Your contribution to this crowdfunding campaign will help demonstrate that Luxe Tea is something that people want to see out in the world.
Help us get to our next milestone!

Your contributions will help fairly compensate the team that's making Luxe Tea possible!  After paying Kickstarter and credit card processing fees, funds will go to our advisors, a chef to develop our initial menu, and founder salary.  Once the initial goal is reached, any further funds will go towards additional menus, advisors, administrative costs, branding, and our buildout.
Twigs Naturals website: www.twigsnaturals.com
Adrian Miller's work: www.soulfoodscholar.com
Verónica's article on tea in Chile (Spanish language): https://revistaaisthesis.uc.cl/index.php/RAIT/article/view/51129/70562

project.name: India In A Cup
project.description: From gardens to glasses

creator.name: Nandita Godbole
creator.biography:
I am an award winning cookbook author, food and travel writer, and consultant. I established my brand 'Curry Cravings (TM) LLC' in 2004 as an umbrella under which I showcase the diversity and complexity of Indian cuisine. 
Thanks to this Kickstarter community, I've successfully published 7 cookbooks, and a novel, including the Gourmand World Cookbook Award winner, Masaleydaar: Classic Indian Spice Blends (2023).
 
I enjoy food: experimenting with it, creating it, capturing its essence and sharing its goodness with friends – new and old.  I love all kinds of flavors. In my kitchen, I strive to create healthy and memorable eats.

I draw from my cultural roots and academic background in design and the sciences and revisit them all through my inherited, all-consuming passion - food.  Food is a direct connection to a culture, to its history, to lands we may not have traveled yet, and to generations, we have never met. 

And that is why I tell the stories I do.
 
Best wishes,
Nandita

titre: What Is In 'India In A Cup'
India In A Cup: Chapter Outline
texte: India In A Cup: from gardens to glasses

​What does the faint, unmistakable aromas of lemongrass, the incomparable sweetness of rose, the unexpected glisten of gold leaf, or a whiff of sandalwood have in common with an Indian kitchen? These are the unmistakable flavors of India, hidden beyond the masala dabba in special sections of an Indian pantry.
India In A Cup is a journey through India’s vast flavor vocabulary, told through its beverages, bridging traditional sips with modern hospitality.

Exploring India’s regions and rituals, its seasons and sips, ‘India In A Cup’ is for the curious home cook and beverage enthusiast eager to master India’s incredible flavors - one delicious cup at a time.
Whether you prefer cocktails or are completely content with zero-proof beverages, ‘India In A Cup’ showcases India’s incredible beverage traditions, making them accessible and approachable.

With this book, you can be the one who always brings the best beverage bonanza to any gathering. With ‘India In A Cup’, you too can tap into the dynamic world of tropical flavors, either spice, fruit, both, or more, and create taste-bud-tingling, gram-worthy sips for your next gathering, be it your morning vitality shot, a brunch, or board game night with friends.
Using the backbone of traditional regional Indian beverage traditions, ‘India In A Cup’ introduces readers to the world of modern Indian beverages. Through rich photography, ‘India In A Cup’:
This is NOT an average cocktail cookbook and you won’t need to update your entire bar either.
Front matter: Acknowledgements & preface

Technical info: 6” X 9” perfect binding, full color, approx. 200 pages
Book: approx. 1.5 lb shipping weight

A traditionally published book is overseen by five or more different departments, each handling every aspect of the publication from start to finish. One team handles editing, another handles photography, another handles design, another handles marketing, another handles PR, and media appearances, etc. Of the price one pays for a book at a traditional bookstore, 10% or less goes to the author. The remainder goes to everyone else. This is the way traditional publishing works. We are not doing that here.

In contrast, my books are indie published (not vanity). They are a one-person project (or 1.5 if you count my husband). The funds raised in this campaign are allocated towards printing the book, packaging materials, and shipping expenses.

My task list as a creator is extensive. For ‘India In A Cup’, I am responsible for the following: researching, recipe development, writing, prop styling & food photography, graphic design and layout, indexing, as well as quality control, plus shipping and handling when the book is completed. For the food styling/ food photography, I am also making all the ceramics for the book and any ceramic rewards. My husband reviews and helps with the line editing and creating digital copies (for Kindle and iBooks), but after being married for 25 years, he also tests recipes, and gets paid in drinks :D In addition, I’m also taking on the necessary task of marketing and press for it, to ensure we capture the highest funding potential, find sponsors as needed to offset raw material costs during recipe testing, and reach audiences who may join the campaign later (through late pledges, only available if the campaign is successful).
BUT I love doing it all - which is what brings me back every. single. time.

In a nutshell, every penny we raise in the campaign goes towards the backer getting their rewards. The sooner we reach our goal, the quicker I can make room for stretch goals with exciting additions, new rewards, etc. It only gets better.
Are you ready to make this happen? Let’s do it!!

project.description: Officially established in 2025, Fireweed Baking Company has acquired a storefront and is accepting donations to help with opening

creator.name: Lynette Pflueger
creator.biography: Chef Lynette Pflueger graduated from the Art Institute of California in Los Angeles with a degree in Culinary Arts in 2006. Since then she has built a career in baking and pastry in various establishments around the country earning recognition from Food & Wine Magazine (nominated for The People’s Best New Pastry Chef, 2013), Starchefs online magazine (featured 2013), and the prestigious James Beard House (Featured Chef, 2016). Since 2023 Lynette has been working in the Tribal Food Sovereignty Program at the Spokane Tribal Network where she is able to combine her culinary knowledge and her passion for traditional foods, plants, medicine, and sustainability to share and learn alongside her tribal community. In 2025 Lynette formally established Fireweed Baking Company, bringing scratch made baked goods to Spokane and the surrounding area.

titre: Fireweed Baking Company, coming soon to 1516 W Riverside Ave, Spokane, Washington. "The Dormitory" is a shared usage building and houses a coffee shop and office spaces and is located in Spokane's historic Brownes Addition neighborhood.

project.name: Kiri: A Japanese Restaurant in North Beach
project.description: San Francisco kids bringing food & drink inspired by Japanese pubs to the people.

creator.name: Brian Jackson Lee
creator.biography: I like serving food

titre: Kiri (霧) translating to 'fog' in Japanese, is a tribute to our city San Francisco.
texte: Japanese knick knacks and nostalgic Japanese products adorn the walls while Motown blends with the chitter chatter of the room. Beef teriyaki & fresh Japanese seafood is washed down with a Kiri Kola or Root beer in hand. Kiri is owned by both Brian Jackson Lee and Brian Ishii -- born & raised San Franciscans who want to open a restaurant that seeks to serve delicious Japanese pub style food in a homelike environment.

A little over two years ago, Brian and Brian met at Rintaro. They independently wanted to open their own restaurants but instead, decided to open up together  - Ishii in charge of the food and Lee shaping the room.

It's been a journey and a half - from 46th & Taraval, to New Taraval Cafe, to Rintaro, we're grateful for those who hosted us, so that we had the opportunity to host you. That being said, we're happy to tell you that we've finally found Kiri's home. We've signed a lease and plan to open early fall of 2026.

Our kickstarter helps us ensure we have a runway to open thoughtfully. This includes much needed cosmetic work, kitchen equipment, final buildout costs, as well as opening inventory. No amount is too small - any amount is appreciated and we humbly ask for your support.
We love restaurants - what they can do for a neighborhood and the space it provides for the people. Most importantly, we just want to serve you damn good Japanese food in our home.
And we can't wait to welcome you.

project.name: Baby Brew: A Gentle Morning Drink for Calm, Focused Kids
project.description: A caffeine-free, coffee-inspired drink made with roasted roots and herbs to support calm, focused mornings.

creator.name: Jynetta Brown
creator.biography: Mom and creator driven by love and purpose. I’m building projects to create better opportunities for my children and families everywhere. Passionate about growth, innovation, and turning ideas into real solutions that make life brighter.

texte: Baby Brew started in my own kitchen, not as a business idea, but as a mom’s intention.
I have two little girls who are curious, driven, and full of big dreams. They watch everything I do, especially in the mornings.

Like so many parents, I begin my day holding a warm cup in my hands. Naturally, they wanted one too. They did not want juice. They did not want sugary cocoa. They wanted to feel included. Grown up. Capable. Ready for the day.
But I did not want to give them caffeine. I did not want sugar spikes or energy crashes. And I definitely did not want to rely on stimulation to help them focus or succeed.
I wanted something better.

So I began experimenting with roasted seeds, roots, and gentle herbs. Ingredients that felt grounding, nourishing, and safe. Something that could support calm, steady mornings. Something that encouraged focus through balance, not buzz.
What came out of that process was Baby Brew, a coffee-inspired, caffeine-free drink made with thoughtfully chosen ingredients to support calm, focused starts to the day.
This is not about creating mini adults.
It is about creating healthy rituals.
It is about modeling balance.
It is about giving our children tools that support who they are becoming without rushing them.
My girls want to excel in life. And I believe excellence does not start with stimulation. It starts with stability, confidence, and calm.
Baby Brew is our small way of helping build that foundation.
And now, we are inviting other families to be part of it.

project.name: Los Orientales — Limited Batch Dulce de Leche (Madrid) (Canceled)
project.description: Small-batch caramelized milk with a honey-like texture. First numbered run made in Madrid—limited jars for early backers.

creator.name: Federico Dalmaud y Matilde Zeballos
creator.biography: Federico Dalmaud and Matilde Zeballos are Uruguayan founders based in Madrid. Communicators by training and food artisans by conviction, they combine cultural storytelling and technical gastronomy to reinterpret Río de la Plata tradition with precision and local production.

titre:
This is not supermarket dulce de leche.
This is slow-fire caramelized milk, cooked for hours in small batches in Spain.
We are launching our first professional, numbered Founders Edition.

If this campaign funds, we produce it.
If it doesn’t, it doesn’t exist.
Only the first batch will be numbered and limited (100 jars).
🛡️ Why you can trust us...
📊 How we’ll use every euro
texte:
• First professional production
• Numbered jars for traceability
• Small, controlled batch
• Made in Madrid
• Limited first run
This is the batch that defines the future of the project.

I trained as a professional cook in Uruguay (IGA, Montevideo).
We’ve worked in professional kitchens and shipped artisan products across Europe.
This project is structured, tested, and carefully planned.
We are not improvising.
We have already shipped artisan products across Europe successfully.
We are an Italian–Uruguayan couple living in Spain for the past four years, raising our two children, Tomás and Clara.
Both of us hold degrees in Communication Studies and have built our careers as entrepreneurs - creating projects where narrative, structure, and execution matter as much as ideas.

Federico has been passionate about cooking since childhood. That passion led him to formally study Gastronomy and Haute Cuisine at the Instituto Gastronómico Argentino (IGA) in Uruguay. In 2013, invited by his friend chef Martín Schwedt, he worked in international kitchen environments in Montevideo, becoming part of the crew supporting Paul McCartney’s show at Estadio Centenario.
Those experiences were not about glamour. They were about discipline, timing, consistency, and respect for craft.
Los Orientales brings together everything we’ve learned: communication, execution, entrepreneurship, and a deep respect for culinary process.

This project is not improvised.
It is deliberate, structured, and built to last.
Los Orientales is slow-cooked dulce de leche made with:

• milk
• sugar
• time
Cooked for hours over low heat until it reaches a silky, honey-like texture.

No additives.
No shortcuts.
No industrial tricks.
This started in a home kitchen. To deliver it properly — safely, consistently, and shippable — we’re funding the first professional step:
certified kitchen production & food-safety compliance
batch control and consistency testing
safe glass jars + protective packaging
numbered first edition + traceability
reward preparation and tracked shipping
Your pledge funds the first professional batch — structured, certified, and ready to ship.

Kitchen, compliance & quality control — 28%
Certified kitchen rental, food-safety compliance, batch control documentation, and quality validation.

Ingredients & test batches — 18%
Fresh local milk, sugar, selected ingredients (pistachio, dates, orange blossom), stability and consistency tests.

Jars, labels & protective packaging — 22%
Glass jars, lids, food-safe labels, numbered batch system, protective inner packaging.

Shipping materials & fulfillment — 17%
Boxes, cushioning, handling time, and tracked shipment preparation.

Platform fees + contingency — 15%
Kickstarter fees (~8–10%), payment processing, and a buffer for unexpected logistics or supply fluctuations.
Dulce de leche is a taste of home in Río de la Plata - often learned in family kitchens, repeated until it becomes muscle memory.

We cook it in Madrid as continuity, not as an import. Same gesture, new place, the same respect for time. Slow fire transforms milk and sugar into something deeper: silky texture, controlled sweetness, a finish you can recognize with your eyes closed.
And because Madrid is also Mediterranean, we’re opening a new chapter with ingredients that feel native here too: pistachio, dates, orange blossom. Not as decoration - as a bridge.
If you back this project, you’re helping turn a home recipe into a first professional, numbered edition - made carefully and delivered properly.
Timeline (real dates over pretty promises)
Mar 20, 2026: campaign ends
Apr–May 2026: first numbered batch production + quality checks
May–Jun 2026: packaging + shipping (Spain rewards first)
Jun–Jul 2026: next steps + future batches planning

replies.text: Hi Ellis,

project.name: The Pig & Swill @ Victoria Park
project.description: The team behind Hiraeth are bringing a quality Tap House to Victoria Park!

creator.name: Andy & Lewis
creator.biography: Hi, Andy & Lewis here. If you are reading this then you are already looking at our project. Thank you. We are just 2 chefs with big ideas and trying to make it happen!

texte: So, here we go again!!

Firstly, we want to say a massive thank you to all those who have supported us on our journey from the early pop up days to the beautiful Vale of Glamorgan village pub and right through to us finding our home in the leafy corner of Victoria Park. It's been truly humbling and we feel right at home!

Hiraeth has gone from strength to strength and due to undertake a bit of a refresh and a kitchen upgrade. Much needed and will be helping us kick on in 2026. We can't wait to get the doors open again and show you all the changes. We've also branched out into event catering so preparing the back of house area to be fit to take on this extra work has been key to our plans. This is all, already, well under way.

So why a crowd fund? Well we have more to tell you! We have taken the keys to another site. Scary stuff! But very exciting! We can see the new site from Hiraeth's front door which is perfect. We want to bring a quality space for people to enjoy that will complement Hiraeth and Victoria Park. We love a pub, always have. So we are bringing a Tap House to Victoria Park. The Pig & Swill is coming!

To deliver all that we have planned we need your help. We'll, as always, be rolling up our sleeves, dusting off the power tools and getting stuck into this ourselves. We don't shy away from the hard work. We just need a little bit of financial help to get this completed.
The Plan

The Kickstarter will go live on ...... and will run for 14 days. We will be looking to raise £25,000 which will all go towards The Pig & Swill. Anything over and above will also go into the Tap House.

We're putting the money towards the fit out of the trading area. We've got walls to plaster, floors to put down, paint, blinds, furniture, a bar to build, toilet to put in, a cellar to build and plenty more!
The aim is to deliver you a space to come and enjoy, relax, meet friends and family. Unpretentious, warm, cosy, dog friendly & full of life!
The food will deliver on what we think you'd want to eat! Think handmade sausage rolls, scotch eggs, overnight bacon, toasties, karaage and perhaps a pork pie!
If this all sounds right up your street then please get pledging. Buy these vouchers and experiences. Come and use them. We can't wait to welcome you to The Pig & Swill!

project.name: Ember Forged Spices
project.description: This kickstarter is to fund the initial production run of the spice line I have been developing over my career in the culinary industry

creator.name: Aaron Deshotel
creator.biography: I've been a Chef for over 25 years, and now I am bringing my personal recipes to the people. This is a passion project at it's core, I want to share my flavors with the world.

texte: Tired of bland "healthy" meals that leave you wanting more?
What if you could ignite bold, restaurant-quality flavor in every home-cooked dish without the guilt, endless guesswork, or hidden junk?

Hi, I'm Aaron, a professional chef with over 20 years in the kitchen. I've crafted signature recipes and seasoning blends that became staples at multiple restaurants, delighting thousands of diners. But my real mission started when I realized most "healthy" options sacrificed taste for nutrition—or vice versa. I wasn't okay with that compromise.

That's why I founded Ember Forged: to forge clean-ingredient spice blends that deliver maximum flavor while prioritizing real nutrition. These aren't generic seasonings—they're smart, chef-crafted shortcuts designed to make nutritious, exciting meals effortless for anyone, from busy weeknight cooks to health-focused foodies.

Launching with versatile, all-purpose blends perfect for your everyday kitchen: grilling, roasting, sautéing, or quick stir-fries. Ember Forge blends give you a killer baseline flavor you can easily customize to make it your own—turning simple ingredients into meals you'll crave.
With your support, we'll expand the Ember Forge line to truly meet everyone:
•      Low-sodium and no-sodium options for heart-healthy eating
•      Sugar-free variations (where it fits naturally)
•      Adaptations for paleo, keto, vegan, and other lifestyles
Everyone deserves food that's delicious, satisfying, and good for you—no trade-offs.
Ember Forge eliminates the trial-and-error so you can focus on enjoying time in the kitchen (or just getting dinner on the table fast).

I'm thrilled to bring these chef-crafted creations from my kitchen to yours under the Ember Forge banner. Join me in building a community around flavorful, feel-good cooking that actually works for real life. Let's forge healthy eating that tastes amazing—together!
Thank you for believing in better food.
Your pledge fuels the fire and gets us one step closer.

project.name: Third Course: Always Tonight at 7:30
project.description: This is the third book in my series of family cookbooks, celebrating our lives in both the United States and London

creator.name: Kristen Frederickson
creator.biography: I am a former art historian and gallery owner turned food writer living in London and in Southbury, Connecticut.  In 2015 I wrote my first cookbook, "Tonight at 7.30," and then in 2020 the second in the series, "Second Helpings" came along.  This book, "Third Course," is the third in the series of books chronicling the dishes I create for family and friends in both our homes.

texte: THIRD COURSE: ALWAYS TONIGHT AT 7.30
If you’ve ever found yourself happier with people around your table than anywhere else on earth, this book is for you.

Third Course: Always Tonight at 7.30 is the third in my series of family cookbooks, celebrating life around our table in two places we love: London (with endless friends and our daughter and her circle) and Connecticut (at Red Gate Farm, surrounded by friends as well but also family: my wonderful mom, my sister and her family). It’s a book of recipes, yes, but also a collection of stories to help us remember the communities we’ve gathered in both countries, and the way food threads through all our days.
But this book was never meant to be! A THIRD volume?  Yes, I said I wouldn’t!

In 2012 I began writing what I called “the cookbook, ”Tonight at 7.30: One Family’s Life at the Table, "the" because there was never going to be a second one (#novolumetwo). That first book launched in 2015, with my husband John beside me, and our daughter Avery Curran, then 18, having taken the brilliant photographs for the book and generally having been my partner in crime.

Of course, I immediately started cooking new things. #novolumetwo became Second Helpings, shaped by friends and family, by the pandemic years, and by the kind of collective encouragement that keeps a home cook brave.  This was Avery's swansong as my food photographer, and what a brilliant job she did, often photographing two meals in one day, to make this book as beautiful as it is.
And now here we are, at Third Course, older, busier, still setting the table, still always aiming for dinner at 7.30.

In this newest book, you’ll become acquainted with our idiosyncratic life under a giant railway arch, you’ll get to know the aisles of our local Turkish shop where everyone calls me “darling,” and the children in my Friday Cooking Club will be among your close friends when you read the chapter about our adventures. Life is made a lot more interesting with Plan Zheroes, our food-surplus charity at Borough Market, and this new book celebrates no-waste cooking like never before.
WHAT THIS BOOK IS (AND ISN’T)

This is not a book of fussy cheffiness. I’m not a precise cook (except when baking frightens me into obedience). My recipes are meant to be flexible: adjusted to suit what’s in your fridge, what’s in season, who’s coming for supper and what they long to eat. The recipes range from simple to more complex, and they’re influenced by the wonderfully diverse cooks and food writers I’ve learned from over the years.

“Third Course” is also a book with a sense of humour about real life in the kitchen. If you’ve followed me online, you’ll know I’m as likely to share the disasters as the triumphs, because cooking becomes so much more enjoyable when you stop feeling you must be perfect. Oh, the times I’ve poured long-simmered chicken stock through a sieve and directly down the kitchen drain!  Or how about the time when I made an elaborate Tom Yum soup paste – garlic, ginger, lemongrass, chillies, coriander and so much more – only to leave it behind in my food processor and feed my guests a soup that was nothing more or less than chicken broth and coconut milk with some mushrooms floating on top.  No one noticed until we did the dishes and discovered the processor full of fragrant paste? Ah, well, I’m human. And for every disaster, there are innumerable delicious successes.  Like creamy, spicy daal. Or a heavenly chocolate babka, perfect for celebrating something special.
WHAT’S INSIDE

Third Course is organised into the sections I most often reach for when I’m feeding people I love: soups, poultry, meat, fish and seafood, pasta, salads and vegetables, sauces, dressings, dips and rubs, sweet things and baked goods, snacks, and a final section close to my heart: Kristen’s Cooking Club.
PHOTOGRAPHS (AND TWO VERY FLUFFY ASSISTANTS)

Unlike my two previous books which were beloved collaborations with my daughter Avery, for Third Course, the photographs are mine. They capture the food, but also the rooms we eat in, the art on the walls behind a plate, and the very real characters who wander through my kitchen. That includes two new, impossibly fluffy family members, Betsy and Tony, who appear more than once (and who have, I regret to report, been known to “help” from the countertop).
THE PANTRY UNDER THE RAILWAY ARCH

Our London home is… unusual. We live under a railway arch, and for the first time in my life I have a “pantry," which is to say: a ground-floor room that became the storage heart of the house, scented with spices and filled with marmalade, plates, bowls, and all the little tricks of my trade. It’s also occasionally a guest bedroom, because life is like that. You’ll see glimpses of it throughout the book.
KRISTEN’S COOKING CLUB

One of the joys of my life over the past decade has been teaching children to cook at local primary schools. The Cooking Club section of Third Course includes child-friendly recipes that work even with very young helpers, plus stories from Friday afternoons that are full of shenanigans, sweetness, and accidental wisdom. It’s one of the parts of the book I’m proudest of, because it’s as much about building confidence and kindness as it is about food.
WHY KICKSTARTER

Kickstarter is the way I love launching these books as a shared event. It gathers the community first, lets me print responsibly, and keeps the process personal, from the first announcement to the final package landing on your doorstep. Kickstarter funds will not only help create the book, but it will make distribution a dream. This book truly becomes a team effort.

If you back this project, you’re not just pre-ordering a book. You’re helping me get a beautiful object into the world (and into kitchens), and you’re joining the circle of people who make my work possible.
REWARDS (A QUICK GUIDE)
I’ve kept the rewards straightforward and genuinely useful:

• $10: four extra dinner-party recipes (appetiser, main, side, dessert) delivered as a beautiful printable page.
• $15: a gorgeous PDF edition.
• $30: a first-edition copy shipped to the US or UK + the PDF.
• $45: a first-edition copy shipped anywhere outside the US/UK.
• Multi-book bundles for gifting (2, 4, or 8 copies).
• A signed first-edition + an apron with original artwork (+ PDF).
• The “come to supper” rewards: dinner for six at Red Gate Farm (Connecticut) or in London, plus signed books and textiles.
THANK YOU

Thank you for reading, sharing, and cooking alongside me. I’m grateful for the friends and family who taste-test, tell the truth, turn up hungry, and keep showing me that a table, set with love, can still be the best place to be.
