project.name: Deadlands 30th Anniversary Celebration
project.description: Deadlands: 30 Years of Games, Grit, and Ghost Rock!

creator.name: Shane Hensley
creator.biography:
This is the official Kickstarter account for Pinnacle Entertainment Group. It's in Shane's name because Kickstarter won't let you change it after you've created a project.

Please visit www.peginc.com to find out more about our company, Savage Worlds, and all our other games!

titre: Deadlands: 30 Years in the Weird West
texte: Deadlands: The Weird West™ launched at the Gen Con game convention in 1996, THIRTY years ago! Since then we've created books, miniatures, novels, comics, card games, and even four spinoffs—Hell on Earth, Lost Colony, Noir, and now Dark Ages! We've even been at the finish line for a television / streaming series or feature film more than half a dozen times (and still working on it!).

We were able to do all this because of YOU. That's not hollow corporate speak. We live it in every decision we make. And now we want to thank all of you—newcomers and veterans alike—with an incredible ONCE-IN-A-LIFETIME EVENT AND 30th Anniversary Celebration book!

Let's start with the book! Inside this lavish tome we'll share the whole story of Deadlands, show off the work of all the incredible artists we've partnered with, tell you what happened behind the scenes of various projects, share some of our best convention stories, bemoan the tale of various Deadlands video game and movie attempts, repeat the famous first edition forewords from beloved authors Joe Lansdale, Mike Stackpole, and actor Bruce Campbell, AND even tell you about the time Bruce played in a live-action version of Deadlands! The book also features a complete cover gallery of most everything we've ever made, displays the covers of our many licenses and foreign translations, AND gives you a sneak peek at what's to come!

And since YOU are part of the Deadlands story, every person who backs the book gets their name IN the book! If it's in your Reward tier OR you add it separately, we'll contact you before it's printed to see what name you want in the Special Thanks page. Feel free to name a loved one, posse member, or your own "Western" name...like Simon "One Eye" Lucas or Jodi "Crit Fail Queen" Black!

But don't trip the hammer yet, pilgrim...there's more! To commemorate this momentous anniversary, we're having a special celebration deep in the heart of cowboy country—Arizona! Tickets are available at our website here, and are limited to the first 100 cowpokes to sign up!

The gathering takes place in October 2026, at Rawhide Western Town near Phoenix, Arizona, and includes gaming, special prizes, cowboy feasts, a genuine zombie crawl, unique prizes, a look at the Deadlands archives, and MORE! Click the image above for the details!

In addition to the book, we've teamed up with one of our long-time friends and artists, the phenomenal Cheyenne Wright, to create a special set of TEN commemorative coins (perfect for Conviction tokens in the game)! Get 'em now, partner, because we don't plan on ever making these again!

Finally, our friends at Modern Artifice have created a one-off set of HUCKSTER DICE exclusive to this Kickstarter! You get all six traditional gaming dice AND a six-sided Wild Die featuring Deadlands cards INSIDE THE DICE! Like the coins, this set will not be available outside this project.

These sharp resin dice are molded in a mystical huckster purple with randomized cards from the Deadlands Action Deck. The extra Wild Die is in fiery gold, with the Deadlands skull on the 6 (Acing!) side, and features two manitou / Joker cards!

The 30th Anniversary Celebration of Deadlands is a retrospective book—part history, part art book, part love letter—looking back at where Deadlands came from, how it evolved, and why it still matters after thirty years. But an anniversary shouldn’t only look back. It should look to the trail ahead.

Alongside this celebration, we’re introducing a new, fully self-contained Deadlands roleplaying game core book with the Savage Worlds rules built in and reflavored just for the Weird West! The book also includes the character-facing material from the Deadlands Companion like Witches, US Marshals, and the Metal Mage Edge.

The new core book contains the core monsters and critters a Marshal needs to run the game. The rest of those from the existing core book have been separated out into a new bestiary AND relic book called Rascals, Varmints, & Relics. This paves the way for brand new bestiaries and relic books—something we haven't done in a long time and are super excited about doing again!

If you already own Deadlands and Savage Worlds, you DON'T NEED to buy these new versions. There are two small updates in this new edition that we'll be giving you for free right on our website (we updated Dueling rules and there's a small clarification on Chases).
If you've been with us for a while and want a treat, take a look at the one-time-only red leather version of the new combined core rules!

As we did with Pathfinder® for Savage Worlds, we want to make sure that when someone NEW discovers Deadlands for the first time—next year, or ten years from now—everything they need to play is in one book.

The Savage Worlds model of one rule book, one setting book will continue for our other lines, but our flagship setting is a gateway to bring more amazing people into our community. Keep right on playing with your existing Savage Worlds Adventure Edition and Deadlands setting book, or pick up the new combined book if that's better for your posse.

We wanted to reward those of you who help us bring this new combined core book to life, so these are Kickstarter campaign exclusive prices. The price for several of the items, including the core, will be higher afterward. (The new core book, for example, is $50 here but will retail for $60.)

And the 30th Anniversary rewards in this campaign are exclusive! We'll produce enough for our backers and any extras may show up at conventions, but they won't become ongoing stock items, so when they're gone, they're gone.

If you’ve been with us for years, this is your chance to celebrate three decades of the Weird West with something meaningful and commemorative. We recommend the limited edition 30th Anniversary Celebration reward, OR the Veteran of the Weird West reward if you want the gorgeous red leather bound rule book, too.

If you’re new, this is the best starting point Deadlands has ever had. The items in the Kickstarter will be more expensive later on, so if you're thinking of saddling up, we recommend the Deadlands Marshal Basic or Plus rewards, or Deadlands All In if you're ready to bite the bullet!
Either way, thank you for being part of the past, present, and future of Deadlands!

The new Deadlands core rules contain the latest edition of the Savage Worlds core rules and everything you need to play, including all the original Arcane Backgrounds and those from the previous Deadlands Companion (including US Marshals, Witches, and Voodooists), and a bestiary of the most important varmints and critters. That includes over a dozen common nonplayer characters, common animals like horses, snakes, swarms, and over a dozen of Deadlands' signature abominations!

A new bestiary called Rascals, Varmints, & Relics includes all the additional creatures from the previous Deadlands setting book and updated profiles for important characters from the now out-of-print Deadlands Companion, along with updated profiles for the Servitors (even those the posse may have dealt with in the Servitor series of adventures). It also includes all the Relics from the previous Deadlands setting book.

Putting all this into a new book keeps the core at a manageable size (332 amazing pages!) and opens the door for future bestiaries just like we've done with Pathfinder for Savage Worlds! This one is currently at the 144 page mark, but we won't have a final page count till we get all our artists' incredible illustrations in there.

The Marshal's Accessories box is a fantastic aid for the Game Master. It includes an Action Deck (oversized so the cards are easier to read around a table) featuring some of the best of Deadlands artwork, die-cut cardboard status tokens, Bennies, and Conviction tokens, a gorgeous GM's screen (three 10.25" x 6.5" panels so you can see over it, Marshal!), a set of dice the color of glistening ghost rock, five dials to track ammo or Power Points, a large poster map of the Weird West, and some handy reference cards for your players!

We're also offering up something brand new with this release! A Powers box that contains reference card SETS for all the Arcane Backgrounds in Deadlands. That includes the blessed, chi master, huckster, mad scientist, shaman, voodooist, and witch! You get a set of cards for EACH of these character types, all on their own beautifully designed graphic background!

For the first time ever, we've created a DEADLANDS STARTER BOX for brand new Marshals! This gorgeous boxed set contains a "Showcase" version of the rules, a complete adventure called The Cursed Caverns, maps, tokens, pawns, Action Deck, Bennies, Templates, AND Archetype cards!

We've even got a special offering for those grizzled gunslingers who've seen a thing or two along the dark frontier. The Veteran of the Weird West reward includes everything in the Celebration bundle (the 30th Anniversary Celebration book, the Huckster Dice, and the Conviction Coins), PLUS a special, signed, leatherbound version of the new combined Savage Worlds and Deadlands core rules!

If you want an extra copy of one of these new or limited items, or if you want to fill in some holes in your collection, you'll be able to add the following items to your pledge once you've chosen your reward level. Everything will be shipped as a single package, which lets you benefit from lower campaign shipping rates, especially for overseas backers.
Of course, you can also just order the older items direct from our new web store and get them delivered right away!
The products in this campaign are written and playtested. Your support allows us to help boost the signal to other fans—by far the hardest challenge for a small company like ours.
We deliver the first PDF a few weeks after the project funds and we get the final backer list from Kickstarter.  This means delivery of the main PDFs about a month after funding.

After the Kickstarter ends, we'll use a pledge manager to collate the physical pledges and then collect shipping once the product is on its way from the printer. You can upgrade your pledge or include more Add-Ons in your order while the pledge manager is open.

Shipping prices are changing rapidly in the current climate, and despite our best efforts global supply chains remain volatile. Given all that's going on in the world, providing an estimate of the rates now rather than closer to shipping is nothing more than a guess.

Our long-time friends Studio 2 will handle all domestic shipping, and we continue to work hard to build relationships with partners around the world. Backers should see costs closer to local rates, and orders to the EU, UK, Canada, and Australia will be Customs friendly.

Since we can't tell you what those rates will be yet, any backer who wishes can downgrade their pledge to the nearest digital option once the rates are established and we'll refund the difference—no questions asked.
Any Questions? Email Pinnacle customer service at info@peginc.com.

By backing this campaign, you consent to receive emails from @peginc.com and @kickstarter.com email addresses for purposes of fulfilling your pledge, updates, and announcements. 

All backers will also be subscribed to the weekly Pinnacle Newsletter which features on-going micro updates for all our outstanding crowdfunding campaigns. You can unsubscribe at any time by clicking the link at the bottom of these emails.

gone.name: Deadlands Starter Box

items.name: Deadlands: the Weird West – Starter Box

options.name: Deadlands: Archetypes Set 1
options.desc: The following (seasoned) Archetypes are included: Agent, Blessed, Chi Master, Explorer, Gunslinger, Harrowed, Hexslinger, Huckster, Mad Scientist, Medicine Woman, Territorial Ranger, Warrior

options.name: Deadlands: Archetypes Set 2
options.desc: The following (seasoned) Archetypes are included: Bounty Hunter, Cowgirl, Metal Mage, Muckraker, Native Scout, Saloon Gal, Sawbones, Shaman, US Marshal, Vaquero, Voodooist, Witch

options.name: Deadlands: Archetypes Set 3
options.desc: The following (seasoned) Archetypes are included: Wrangler, Buffalo Hunter, Gun for Hire, Ranch Hand, Desperado, Pistolero, Wandering Preacher, Mysterious Stranger, Drifter, Tinhorn, Camp Cook, Ranger

options.name: Deadlands: Archetypes Set 4
options.desc: The following (seasoned) Archetypes are included: Determined Agent, Harrowed Desperado, Hexslinging Cardsharp, Sister of Mercy, Ruthless Gunslinger, Confident Houngan, Eccentric Tinkerer, Sharpshooting Bounty Hunter, Crafty Huckster, Wandering Master, Cavalry Officer, Rugged Adventurer

options.name: Deadlands: Archetypes Set 5
options.desc: The following (seasoned) Archetypes are included: Coastal Shaman, Cryptozoologist, Elderly Sifu, Fur Trapper, Industrialist, Lumberjack, Salish Warrior, Naturalist, Old Timer, Pioneer, Trophy Hunter, Whaler

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 1
options.desc: This double sided map features a showy saloon and surrounding town attractions. The maps are printed on sturdy 24 x 30 inches cardstock and are wet and dry marker erasable.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 2
options.desc: This double sided map features a church and graveyard with other nearby attractions for your posse. The maps are printed on sturdy 24 x 30 inches cardstock and are wet and dry marker erasable.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 3
options.desc: Features a train station, corner saloon, and other classic western buildings. Deadlands Map Packs are large, 30" x 24"" double-sided laminated maps for use with miniatures or our Deadlands pawns.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 4
options.desc: Features wilderness terrain ideal for use in Deadlands: Blood Drive. Deadlands Map Packs are large, 30" x 24"" double-sided laminated maps for use with miniatures or our Deadlands pawns.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 5
options.desc: Features a boomtown in full swing, with everything from picket lines and tents to the proud beginnings of a main street. The maps are printed on sturdy 24 x 30 inches cardstock and are wet and dry marker erasable.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 6
options.desc: Features a prospector's camp with mine shaft, miner's tents, and panning stations. The maps are printed on sturdy 24 x 30 inches cardstock and are wet and dry marker erasable.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 7
options.desc: Features rail spurs, a saw-mill, cabins, and plenty of logs as cover, while the reverse side features a remote trading post out in the snowy wilds. 30" x 24"" double-sided laminated maps for use with miniatures or our Deadlands pawns.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 8
options.desc: Features a coastal town with long houses, a line of canoes ready for action, and totems, while the reverse side features a snowy pass ready for an ambush, avalanche, or both! 30" x 24"" double-sided laminated maps for use with miniatures or our Deadlands pawns.

options.name: Deadlands Edge Cards
options.desc: 92 Edges specific to Deadlands on oversized cards.

options.name: Deadlands: Rise of the Black Circle GN
options.desc: Deadlands: Rise of the Black Circle collects all three issues of the Rise of the Black Circle limited series by the acclaimed creative team of writer Shane Hensley, artist Aaron Palsmeier, and colorist Simon Gough.

options.name: Deadlands: Power Cards
options.desc: All the powers used in Deadlands: the Weird West, updated to their latest and greatest versions and now on oversized cards.

options.name: Deadlands: The Horror at Headstone Hill
options.desc: Get them while they last. Horror at Headstone Hill is a sandbox campaign setting, fully detailing this small section of the Weird West.

options.name: Deadlands:Pawns Boxed Set 1
options.desc: The Deadlands Pawns Boxed Set contains 8 sheets of thick punchboard, containing over 100 pawns to bring the Weird West alive on your tabletop. Cardboard bases included.

options.name: Deadlands:Pawns Boxed Set 2
options.desc: The Deadlands Pawns Boxed Set contains 8 sheets of thick punchboard, containing over 100 pawns to bring the Weird West alive on your tabletop. Cardboard bases included.

options.name: Deadlands: Rascals, Varmints, & Relics
options.desc: Contains Encounter Tables, foes, and relics found across the Weird West. Includes the PDF version for free.

options.name: Deadlands: Anniversary Huckster Dice
options.desc: Campaign exclusive dice from Modern Artifice. Contains a d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, and a six-sided Wild Die.

options.name: Deadlands: Anniversary Conviction Coins
options.desc: Campaign exclusive set of ten metal Conviction Coins, all themed for the Weird West.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West – Starter Box
options.desc: New to Deadlands? The Starter Box offers everything you need to start playing: rules, adventures, maps, pawns, dice, and tokens.

options.name: Deadlands: Carnage in the Cascades
options.desc: The whole Pacific Northwest is close to becoming a Deadland—and only the posse has the grit to stop it from happening. Carnage in the Cascades provides more monsters, pawns, maps, and a passel of props to help bring the game to life!

options.name: Deadlands: Hell on the High Plains
options.desc: Learn more about Colorado, Dakota, Kansas, Montana, Nebraska, and Wyoming. A trail guide with a wealth of lore along with new Savage Tales, critters, locations, relics, and more!

options.name: Deadlands: The Abominable Northwest
options.desc: Learn more about Idaho Territory, Oregon, and Washington. A trail guide with a wealth of lore along with new Savage Tales, critters, locations, relics, and more!

options.name: Deadlands: 30th Anniversary Celebration
options.desc: Celebrate 30 years of Deadlands in style with this thrilling retrospective. Note that this collector's item is only available in physical format, no digital version is being created.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West – Core Rules
options.desc: The core rules for Deadlands: the Weird West, now with the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition rules included. Includes the PDF version for free!

options.name: Deadlands: Marshal Accessories Box
options.desc: The Marshal Accessories Box contains an Action Deck, status tokens, Bennies, Conviction tokens, a GM's screen, and dice.

options.name: Deadlands: Night Train
options.desc: The Night Train lurks the tracks of the West, pulling in after dark to unleash its Hellish cargo on unsuspecting towns along ther rails. What will you do when its deadly whistle blows? Can your posse survive the onslaught? Many others have tried... and failed!

options.name: Deadlands Leather Bound Core Book
options.desc: A deluxe leather bound copy of the 2026 core rules for Deadlands: the Weird West, now with the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition rules included. Includes the PDF version for free!

options.desc: Features wilderness terrain ideal for use in Deadlands: Blood Drive. Deadlands Map Packs are large, 30" x 24"" double-sided laminated maps for use with miniatures or our Deadlands pawns.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 5
options.desc: Features a boomtown in full swing, with everything from picket lines and tents to the proud beginnings of a main street. The maps are printed on sturdy 24 x 30 inches cardstock and are wet and dry marker erasable.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 6
options.desc: Features a prospector's camp with mine shaft, miner's tents, and panning stations. The maps are printed on sturdy 24 x 30 inches cardstock and are wet and dry marker erasable.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 7
options.desc: Features rail spurs, a saw-mill, cabins, and plenty of logs as cover, while the reverse side features a remote trading post out in the snowy wilds. 30" x 24"" double-sided laminated maps for use with miniatures or our Deadlands pawns.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West Map Pack 8
options.desc: Features a coastal town with long houses, a line of canoes ready for action, and totems, while the reverse side features a snowy pass ready for an ambush, avalanche, or both! 30" x 24"" double-sided laminated maps for use with miniatures or our Deadlands pawns.

options.name: Deadlands Edge Cards
options.desc: 92 Edges specific to Deadlands on oversized cards.

options.name: Deadlands: Rise of the Black Circle GN
options.desc: Deadlands: Rise of the Black Circle collects all three issues of the Rise of the Black Circle limited series by the acclaimed creative team of writer Shane Hensley, artist Aaron Palsmeier, and colorist Simon Gough.

options.name: Deadlands: Power Cards
options.desc: All the powers used in Deadlands: the Weird West, updated to their latest and greatest versions and now on oversized cards.

options.name: Deadlands: The Horror at Headstone Hill
options.desc: Get them while they last. Horror at Headstone Hill is a sandbox campaign setting, fully detailing this small section of the Weird West.

options.name: Deadlands:Pawns Boxed Set 1
options.desc: The Deadlands Pawns Boxed Set contains 8 sheets of thick punchboard, containing over 100 pawns to bring the Weird West alive on your tabletop. Cardboard bases included.

options.name: Deadlands:Pawns Boxed Set 2
options.desc: The Deadlands Pawns Boxed Set contains 8 sheets of thick punchboard, containing over 100 pawns to bring the Weird West alive on your tabletop. Cardboard bases included.

options.name: Deadlands: Rascals, Varmints, & Relics
options.desc: Contains Encounter Tables, foes, and relics found across the Weird West. Includes the PDF version for free.

options.name: Deadlands: Anniversary Huckster Dice
options.desc: Campaign exclusive dice from Modern Artifice. Contains a d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, and a six-sided Wild Die.

options.name: Deadlands: Anniversary Conviction Coins
options.desc: Campaign exclusive set of ten metal Conviction Coins, all themed for the Weird West.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West – Starter Box
options.desc: New to Deadlands? The Starter Box offers everything you need to start playing: rules, adventures, maps, pawns, dice, and tokens.

options.name: Deadlands: Carnage in the Cascades
options.desc: The whole Pacific Northwest is close to becoming a Deadland—and only the posse has the grit to stop it from happening. Carnage in the Cascades provides more monsters, pawns, maps, and a passel of props to help bring the game to life!

options.name: Deadlands: Hell on the High Plains
options.desc: Learn more about Colorado, Dakota, Kansas, Montana, Nebraska, and Wyoming. A trail guide with a wealth of lore along with new Savage Tales, critters, locations, relics, and more!

options.name: Deadlands: The Abominable Northwest
options.desc: Learn more about Idaho Territory, Oregon, and Washington. A trail guide with a wealth of lore along with new Savage Tales, critters, locations, relics, and more!

options.name: Deadlands: 30th Anniversary Celebration
options.desc: Celebrate 30 years of Deadlands in style with this thrilling retrospective. Note that this collector's item is only available in physical format, no digital version is being created.

options.name: Deadlands: the Weird West – Core Rules
options.desc: The core rules for Deadlands: the Weird West, now with the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition rules included. Includes the PDF version for free!

options.name: Deadlands: Marshal Accessories Box
options.desc: The Marshal Accessories Box contains an Action Deck, status tokens, Bennies, Conviction tokens, a GM's screen, and dice.

options.name: Deadlands: Night Train
options.desc: The Night Train lurks the tracks of the West, pulling in after dark to unleash its Hellish cargo on unsuspecting towns along ther rails. What will you do when its deadly whistle blows? Can your posse survive the onslaught? Many others have tried... and failed!

options.name: Deadlands Leather Bound Core Book
options.desc: A deluxe leather bound copy of the 2026 core rules for Deadlands: the Weird West, now with the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition rules included. Includes the PDF version for free!

project.name: For the Gods!
project.description: Conquer the Greek islands by building towering monuments to the Gods!

creator.name: Mighty Boards
creator.biography: Mighty Boards is the board game development studio that brought you Rebirth, Art Society, Fateforge: Chronicles of Kaan, Petrichor, Hamlet: The Village Building Game, Vengeance: Roll & Fight, Posthuman, Posthuman Saga, Vengeance and Excavation Earth among other titles. Our aim is to make beautifully crafted board games, evoking worlds that generate stories. We believe that rules, stories and the visuals and pieces that express them are key to creating a great board gaming experience. To this end, we place great importance on innovative systems, gorgeous graphics and top-quality game pieces.

texte: Note: The rulebook is not finalized, but we have created a document for you where you can leave comments and feedback if you'd like.

There are 12 unique gods in the game. In a 2 player game, you would use 4 gods, in a 3 player game 5 gods, and in a 4 player game 6 gods. For your first game, the rulebook recommends certain gods instead of a random selection.
Learn more about the gods in our upcoming Kickstarter updates!
Read the interview by The Boardgame Chronicle with David Thompson here!

These shipping rates are estimates based on anticipated item weights and will be charged after the campaign ends through the pledge manager. These rates are subject to change. Soon after the Kickstarter campaign concludes, you will receive an email inviting you to the pledge manager where you can confirm your address, change your pledge level and pay for shipping.

For this campaign, we will offer friendly shipping to the USA (please read carefully the note below), Canada, Europe, Asia, Australia and UK. If your country does not fall into one of these regions you may incur any additional import fees/duties as applicable by your local legislation. We will send games to our partner warehouses in these regions in order to keep the shipping costs as low as possible for you. Any other region will be fulfilled from the closest hub to your country. Unfortunately, import laws prohibit us from shipping games to certain countries. Our partners DO NOT SHIP TO: Iran, Kazakhstan, Russia, Ukraine, Venezuela, Afghanistan, and Cuba.

US backers: We remain committed to delivering your rewards with the least possible burden on you, our backers. However, due to the fluid and unpredictable tariff situation in the US, we must reserve the right to request an additional shipping charge. This charge will be based on the actual production and import costs of your pledge level. To ensure fairness, it will only be calculated and collected closer to the delivery date, when the exact charges are known.

Malta backers: We offer a Free Shipping option for Maltese backers who want to pick up their game(s) from our office in Malta. You will be able to select this option in the pledge manager once the campaign closes.

SPIEL & PAX U pick-ups: During this Kickstarter campaign, you can get the Limited Edition at 55 EUR excl. VAT with free SPIEL & PAX U pick-up. You can select this free pick-up option in the Pledge Manager.

Add-ons & extras
We take the shipping cost of 1x Glory Tokens add-on per backer onto us. Multiple add-ons may increase the shipping cost, which will be calculated in the pledge manager.

What about VAT?
It is important to note that VAT is a sales tax that is separate from import taxes or duties. In countries where VAT is applied, we are legally bound to collect and pay VAT on the value of the total of the pledge and shipping amount according to the VAT rates of each respective country. VAT will be charged in the pledge manager.

Mighty Boards offers the Limited Edition to retailers and partners for a limited run during this Kickstarter campaign. Please back the Merchant's Pledge if you'd like to order the Limited Edition. The Metal Glory Tokens add-on will be available to Merchants during the Pledge Manager, once the campaign ends.

Please note that the pledge manager will only remain open until April 17th, giving you approximately three weeks to upgrade your pledge and add any additional items to your order. Mighty Boards will also distribute a For the Gods! standard edition throughout the world. Planned release is Q4 2026. For all inquiries, please contact: sales@mighty-boards.com.

replies.text: Hi Ralph - thanks for the kind words and glad to have you on board!

The dynamic end of the game, as detailed above, is one of the really cool things about this game. I discourage players knowing exactly what tokens they have in their bag or even how many, that way you're left on the edge, not knowing if this will be your last move. Sometimes you want/need one more turn, other times you may want to cut short someone else's plans by racing through your stones and ending quickly

comments.text: Any chance that the components could be re-wood instead of plastic? That was used for rebirth and it’s so nice!

replies.text: Hey David - we did consider Rewood from the beginning; however, the amount of components that would need to be made from Rewood (around 260 components in total) would significantly increase production costs and manufacturing time; thus, to keep the Limited Edition at an accessible price point and to fulfil this project within a few months, we went for plastic - using plastic also significantly reduces the overall weight of the box, helping us keep shipping and tariff costs as low as possible.
Makes sense. Regardless this game is beautiful, really looking forward to it!

replies.text: Hi John - while both games feature Greek gods and vertical building, the gameplay is fundamentally different. For the Gods! is not an abstract game; it's a tactical area-majority game, where your bag functions as your "engine" and you're essentially choosing when to commit stones to a region and how many, and timing god powers for maximum impact. The similarities are mostly thematic - mechanically, they occupy very different spaces :)
Cette personne a annulé son engagement.

project.name: Hike! Husky Meeples & New Expansion
project.description: Hike! a card-drafting racing game is back with engraved husky meeples and new huskies!

creator.name: SnowBoardGames
creator.biography: SnowBoardGames is an independent board game publishing studio from Slovenia, Europe. We create thinky board games that bring people together and whisk you into adventure!

texte: If you are wondering about the name, Hike! is a command that mushers (dog drivers) use to start their teams. 🙂
The gameplay and components of the base game and the new expansion ( and obviously also the meeples :) ) are language-independent. The Events and Traits expansion has some English text on the cards.

The rulebook in the base game box is English, and we have the translations of the original rulebook available online in Dutch, French, German, Greek, Italian, Japanese, Serbian, Slovene and Spanish. Here.
The revised rulebook, included in this campaign will be in English, and we will work on offering more languges online in the future.
Secret Recipe, wich can be added as an add-on, also has language-independent gameplay and components. The rulebook translations can be found here.
The huskies have different characters - make sure they like their neighbours.
Use the husky movement points to move across the snowy landscape.
Is your team better on technical terrain, or do they like running through powder?
Note that some of the reviewers show a Kickstarter preview copy - the quality and components of the production copy are higher, and some of the rules more streamlined.
Add-ons are things you can add to your pledge after you select your reward. They will be shipped together with the rewards, so they are a great way to optimise shipping.
The gameplay and components are language-independent. The rulebook translations can be found here.
You know that being visible is everything for a Kickstarter campaign. As an indie publisher, we can not compete with the big publishers’ marketing budgets.
But we CAN run a very personal campaign and create a space where our backers can interact and share their thoughts. We hope you join us in the discussion and help us create a community.
And as a bonus, the engagement will hopefully make this campaign more visible, bringing in more funds, and allowing us to make improvements to the game and the campaign for everybody.
But in any case, it’s fun revealing some bonuses and candies during the campaign, isn’t it?
We have prepared some cool things, starting with a new husky illustration: if we get 500 comments in the comment section, our illustrator, Paulina, will draw one additional husky.

And let’s kick-start this one: we absolutely love the names on the husky cards, and we have 22 new huskies waiting to be named. Let us know your suggestions in the comments! And see update #2 for the instructions on how to vote for the suggestions you like.
Shipping will be charged after the campaign. We ship worldwide.
If you wish to receive just the new rulebook, the shipping is around 4€ anywhere in the world. For all the other pledges, the shipping estimates are:

EU: VAT is included. Ships from within EU.
US: If the tariffs stay at approximately where they are, they are included in the price. If something crazy happens, we will monitor it and adapt to find a good solution, which could be just delaying the shipping until the tariffs are back to normal.
CA and AU: Customs-friendly shipping.

Note that the shipping will be charged after the campaign and that the given rates are estimates. In both our previous campaigns, the shipping was either as estimated, or we were able to get better prices, especially for areas with more backers.

SnowBoardGames is an independent board game publishing studio from Slovenia, Europe. We launched and fulfilled our first game, Hike!, on Kickstarter in 2022 with the help of 3451 backers who helped us raise almost €120.000.

We strive for immersive mechanics, great art and quality components, and we believe in a bigger game in a smaller box – without fancy inserts and half-empty boxes – to save your shelf space and optimise the shipping. We manufacture most of our games and game components in Europe.
Hi, we are Nika and Blaž, designers of Hike! and co-founders at SnowBoardGames.

Nika Mlinarič Hribar is a physicist with experience in the aviation industry, working as a researcher in the field of numerical simulations. Blaž Hribar is a civil engineer who specialises in creating indoor spaces optimised for the user. We are working in science and engineering from Monday to Thursday, and running SnowBoardGames on Fridays and rainy weekends. We are an active couple who enjoy board games, climbing, mountaineering and exploring the outdoors.

Paulina Wach is a concept artist and illustrator from Poland who specialises in portraits and animal drawings. She loves Polish folklore arts. She is the author of the gorgeous illustrations that bring Hike! to life.

Hande Koçhan is an illustrator from Turkey. She combines references from abandoned buildings and plants in her illustrations. She likes journaling, indie games, collecting and working on miniature sketchbooks in her free time. She is the designer who translated the husky characters into the awesome engraved meeple designs.

comments.text: Welcome to the campaign! We're happy to see you join 😊

replies.text: The names from the original game won't be repeated, so we can have as many different names as possible.

comments.text: C'mon Star Wars fans. Vote for Anakin. He was an amazing bi-eyed red husky that was a world (and space obviously) traveller.
Suggesting Karadah. He was my grandparents sled dog who was happiest when mushing. Took us on jaunts as little kids in the one-dog sled every winter. Beautiful dog.
Hi, I've pledged for the game as my daughter(9) loves Huskies; she's had a toy one for years called Storm with a white face and grey markings. She'd be thrilled to see one called Storm in the game.

replies.text: Hi Paul - I think there's a high chance there will be one - there's already a Storm suggestion below, so I invite you to upvote that one, too :)

comments.text: I have a second name to suggest, Rougarou.  Rougarou means a wolf-man creature in Louisiana Cajun folklore who searches at night looking for misbehaving children.  But our Rougarou was not a monster at all.  He was very smart, loving, and loyal.  My oldest granddaughter was training and showing him in 4-H dog shows.  He was doing so great!  But sadly we lost him last year.  He was only three years old and is greatly missed.  He was a German shepherd dog instead of a Husky, but his name would make a good name for a Husky.

replies.text: He sounds like a lovely dog! I think you have a fellow Louisianian in the comments - Rougarou is already suggested, too, and I believe doing quite well :)
Rougarou was doing so well for Ruby. I would love to see his name in the game as a memorial to him and all the work she put in with him.

comments.text: Saber would be a good name for one of the Husky cards.  Our Saber is a Husky Malamute who is smart, loyal, and loving.  One of my granddaughters trains and shows him in 4-H shows.  They do showmanship, obedience, rally-obedience, and agility.  They have formed a strong bond and Saber does so well with her that they have qualified to go to the state fair several years in a row.

replies.text: Hello Della, if you scroll down, you will find another Saber suggestion - you can increase the chances by upvoting that one :)
Saber was bought by my fiance and my daughter "stole" his affection. She is his girl and he loves spending time with him

comments.text: I would like to suggest Natasha.   This little girl selected me out of a liter of 3 girls.  She came right up to me and sat on my foot.  Would love to see a dog named after her in the game.  She has the most beautiful blue eyes and is the best doggie ever.

replies.text: Welcome Natasha :)
Go for Natasha
Go for Natasha

comments.text: I would like to suggest a second white husky with a larger frame for the illustration!

replies.text: Noted, thank you for the suggestion! :) We are thinking about how to allow photo suggestions - unfortunately, I don't think there's a way on Kickstarter, but we could do it on Facebook.

comments.text: The other is Ryley.  Both are Black/Grey/White, with slight red in a couple of spots.

replies.text: I vote for Ryley.
And, we have another R suggestion! Apparently, we've been missing some letters in the base game.

comments.text: so we have 2 "new" 5 yrs old huskies, Nikita.  Going with a Siberian/Russian inspired name.

replies.text: I see name variations with Ns and Ks seem to be very popular in this campaign - I think we have Nika, Nuka, Niko, Nikita, and then also Miko and Mika, and I'm probably missing some more.

comments.text: I'd like to propose Isis

replies.text: Ohhh, that's so sad, I'm sorry for your loss. I hope we get to see her in the game.
If she was still there, she would be with 3 other husky with short names with Nordic inspiration:)
Aurore is a good name. Sorry about your loss at a young age.

comments.text: Buffy!

replies.text: Go Buffy! Love the background story :)
This is cute, I'd love to have a buffy.
Love this name.

comments.text: Like many people here, I would like to suggest a name of one of my own dogs (long since passed): Chienelle. The name is an attempt of an English-speaking child to create a feminine version of the French word for dog, Chien.

replies.text: I like it
I can't decide which is cuter, the name or the story. ❤️

comments.text: Another great name is Mystic, he was our other Husky we had, he unfortunately had Epilepsy, so he passed way to young.  He was a White Pie-Eyed baby.  But his name could live on as any color patterned Husky.

replies.text: I like Mystic
Always a good name – I have a Mistic!
Mystic is a good name.

comments.text: i would like to suggest Storm, she was the best Husky in the world (to our family at least.)

replies.text: Looks like there is already a Storm in the game.
I like Storm
I like Storm.

comments.text: I would like to submit Teka, no story just another great animal!

replies.text: I like Teka, too! :)  +1 from me!
Teka appreciates the vote!
Great name.

comments.text: And Ulysses for U covers the English alphabet, at least. ;)

replies.text: Woo!
Ulysses is a good choice for a lead dog.
Maybe, although there's a chance he could get a little lost and be delayed by some crazy adventures along the way.

comments.text: Well, now I've started something. There aren't any J names in the base game either, so how about Juniper?

replies.text: I love the quest to complete the alphabet. :) +1!
Just having fun with it! :)

comments.text: Name Suggestion: Murphy.

replies.text: omg you guys a one step ahead of the game XD. well i guess ill just help upvote for other name then :3 cant wait to see the final piece with all the names
I like Murphy.
Glad to hear that Murphy is already a name in the game.

comments.text: And there also aren't any P names in the base game. I already voted for Photon below, but I'll also throw out Phantom.

replies.text: I like Photon, as fast as light!
@Pierre, you can find Photon a few comments down, but these votes will go to Phantom ;)
Both are good options!

comments.text: Or Quicksilver?

replies.text: Speedy name for a speedy doggo!
Go Quicksilver!
Yeah!

comments.text: There also aren't any Q names in the base game. How about Quest?
Another R name: Rogue.

replies.text: I actually like this one even better than Ranger. I can think of a husky who should be named Rouge.
This World of Warcraft nerd approves of this name in a board game! +1!
Lots of huskies are rather roguish!

comments.text: I noticed there aren't any R names in the base game, so how about Ranger?

replies.text: No worries. I had some free time, and I had gotten the game out to answer a question earlier, so I decided I might as well. :)
Ranger would be another good name.
Ranger would make a great lead dog, picking out the safest path!

comments.text: Nova, for my wonderful Golden Retriever...

replies.text: Hello Nova! I think you'll be happy to hear that Nova is already in the base game :)

project.name: Altheya: The Dragon Empire – A High-Fantasy 5E Setting
project.description: Enter a land where dragons rule, planes clash in eternal wars, and magical vaults hold ancient secrets. A campaign setting for DnD.

creator.name: Roll & Play Press
creator.biography:
Roll & Play Press is an independent publisher that makes playing RPGs easy for GMs and players. 

Since launching in 2020, we've run twelve successful crowdfunding campaigns, shipped tens of thousands of books, and won multiple awards, including 3 ENNIE Awards and 2 UKGE Awards!

titre: Meet the Team – Roll & Play Press
texte: The Dragon Empire is fracturing. The gods are distant. Ancient vaults are opening. The sky itself falls.

Altheya: The Dragon Empire is a high-fantasy campaign setting for DnD 5E created by High Rollers. It's built for the kind of sprawling, heroic adventures you've always dreamed of running. The book is broken into chapters, one for each of the Empire's draconic provinces.

The Empress Bundle is our all-in pledge level, giving you every reward from the campaign with an incredible 30% SAVING. You’ll get a signed copy of Altheya: The Dragon Empire (your choice of cover), an incredible GM Screen, Limited Edition Art Prints, two stunning Dispel Dice sets, every stretch goal we unlock, and so much more. If you’re based in the UK, US or Australia, SHIPPING IS FREE for this pledge!

There are two Empress Bundle options: one has the Standard Edition cover of Altheya: The Dragon Empire, and one has the exclusive Crownsteel Edition – a textured, foiled and embossed cover with gilded edges and a ribbon bookmark. Everything else in the bundle is identical, and the book content is the same in both editions.
Choose the right pledge level to get the cover you want.
Whichever edition you choose, your book comes signed by the High Rollers cast as part of the Empress Bundle!

The world of Altheya is expansive and magical, but its continents are isolated, with each governed by its own unique power structure. Ilmera, the continent where your campaign will unfold, is ruled by seven arch-dragons.

For centuries after a catastrophic divine event called the Brightstorm, the Dragon Empire kept the peace. That was, until five years ago, when the Dragon Empress was killed. The time of peace is now over.

Spies, assassins and foreign powers watch and wait to take the dragon rulers down. Ancient protomagi vaults are opening across the land, spewing vaultspawn and aberrations into a world that was once theirs. Brave adventurers stand up for Ilmera's survival and defend the innocent. Their heroism and hope will determine the fate of the continent.

Altheya: The Dragon Empire is a full campaign setting for DnD 5E (2014 and 2024), designed to support long-running games full of exploration and high-stakes heroism. The A4-sized hardcover book (210 x 297mm, 8.5 x 11.5 inches) is packed with tons of inspiring lore, game master guidance and player content across its 200+ pages, empowering you to tell heroic stories.
Inside you’ll find the continent of Ilmera, fully detailed province by province:

Around 80% of the book is detailed lore (history, worldbuilding, factions, people and places), all fully usable with the 2014 rules, 2024 rules or even non-DnD systems. The game mechanics like monsters, spells, magic items and subclasses are written using 2024 DnD ruleset. Most of the book's mechanical content can be used in a 2014 game as written or with minor tweaks, keeping the book flexible whichever version you play.
There are four new DnD 5E mechanics that Altheya: The Dragon Empire adds to your games, to make your adventures across Ilmera even more epic and heroic.

Harness fate to twist your luck. At the start of the session, the players and GM each roll a d6: on 1–3 it goes to the GM’s pool, on 4–6 it goes to the players’ pool. Anyone can spend a die from their side’s pool to gain a buff or trigger a special feature. When you spend a die, it passes to the other side though, so choose your moment wisely.

Fragments of the Crown (the shattered god prison floating above Altheya) sometimes fall to earth. This 'crownsteel' is illegal to harvest, but that doesn't stop power-hungry artificers and adventurers seeking it out. Weapons and armour forged from crownsteel grant immense strength, but be warned, the material can corrupt or mutate its user.

Uncover brand-new Relics, magic items that harness the world's magic to grow more powerful. Each begins at Tier 1, but can rise to Tier 2 or 3 by completing extraordinary in-world achievements. For example, a dragon-bone mace might only upgrade after being plunged into the lava of a treacherous Caldran volcano.

The wilds of Ilmera are vast and unknown. With these travel rules, choose a Leader to guide each leg of the journey and everyone else takes a role like Quartermaster, Lookout and more. Each role shapes the skill challenges and encounters you face. You won’t need to role-play every day on the road, instead, travel unfolds quickly with meaningful choices and tense moments along the way.

There are enough magic items in the book to fill an arch-dragon's hoard. From Uncommon gear your party might pilfer from a noble, to Relics that lie within the most heavily defended protomagi vaults. Take a look at some featured magic items below.
Battlefield-focused consumables used by soldiers, mercenaries and adventurers alike. With a Bonus Action, weapons or ammunition gain elemental damage for a full minute.

A mark of favour from a dragon noble, recognised across the Empire and backed by imperial records. The ring enhances social influence and grants a spell tied directly to the dragon host who issued it, making it as politically powerful as it is magical.

Weapons and armour forged from crownsteel grant exceptional benefits, such as enhanced ability checks, saving throws and combat effectiveness. But, crownsteel is corrupting. Characters who use crownsteel items must bear its curse, which could lead to horrifying mutations, flaws and even shifts in ability scores over time. Crownsteel items are powerful, but come at a dreadful cost.

Altheya is inhabited by all kinds of dangerous fantasy creatures. That's without mentioning the horrors that emerge from protomagi vaults, the cultists who transform themselves in new and wicked ways, and the abominations birthed by the Embered Gods. The book features all-new stat blocks to use in your games. Take a look at some featured monsters below:

The Awoken don't just buy, steal and hunt for protomagi relics – they consume them. These humanoid creatures have lost every shred of their humanity, and have fully given over to their greed and lust for powerful magic. Approach with extreme caution.

Relentless insectoids who live in the deep, dark places of the world. Belamorphs can smell minerals from miles away, then they dig towards them, devour them, and feed them to their queen. Their love of precious metals makes them a blight for adventurers and merchants alike.

Powerful nobles like Duke Ignarious (pictured above) own huge swathes of land, given to them by their province's arch-dragon. These immense dragons have the ability to grant favours, deeds or magic items to over-achieving adventurers. Each noble is formidable, and can appear in either humanoid or dragon form.

The book introduces two brand-new subclasses that players can utilise when creating their next character – and SIX more unlocked by stretch goals! They have been crafted specially for the world of Altheya, but will work in any fantasy setting.

A martial druid who protects the land and its inhabitants with steel and bark. Greenshield Druids summon ethereal armour, empower their strikes and stand as living defenders against blight and dark magic.
SPECIAL FEATURES: martial weapon proficiency, expend wildshape slots to boost your AC, grant temporary hit points, defend your closest allies, and more.
A brutal, tragic and gruesome path for those who wield great strength even in the depths of their pain. Bloodfury barbarians turn injury into momentum, pushing themselves beyond mortal limits.
SPECIAL FEATURES: gain blood points when striking foes or taking damage, spend blood points to enhance your weapons, gain a whirlwind attack, and more.
If you can't make your mind up between the add-ons, or are looking for some extra info, we've got you covered. Keep scrolling to read all about the extra rewards you can bag as part of this campaign.

A decadent collector's edition of Altheya: The Dragon Empire – the Crownsteel Edition is made to look as though it's carved from rock. We've spared no expense with embossing, foil printing, foil stamping, gilded golden edges and even a ribbon bookmark. These books will have ONE print run only, and then they're gone forever. (Beware: crownsteel may curse, corrupt or mutate the user)

Get your copy of Altheya: The Dragon Empire signed by the whole High Rollers cast! There are two ways of getting a signed book: 1) pledge at any Empress Bundle tier, or 2) upgrade your Standard Edition or Crownsteel Edition book to a signed version in the pledge manager after the campaign.
Signed Standard Edition books are priced at £145; Signed Crownsteel Edition books are priced at £180.

We've teamed up with Dispel Dice to bring you a liquid core set that Duke Ignarious himself would be proud of. This seven-piece dice set is sharp-edged, with a translucent red resin shell, gold ink, and swirling glitter liquid core interior.

What better way to tap into the whims of fate, than with a beautiful set of Dispel Dice? This set of seven d6 dice can be passed around as fate tokens when using the Crucible of Fate rules included in the Altheya: The Dragon Empire book. The dice are sharp-edged, and poured with a deep-blue glitter resin.

Choose from the Altheya Logo 1.5" Pin or the Faction 1" Pin Set. The Altheya Logo Pin is backed on gold metal with a d20 design of the Altheya logo. The Faction Pin Set comes with three faction symbols: The Watchtower (an imperial spy agency), The Diadem (a powerful criminal syndicate), The Mark of the Dragon Empress.

Fly across the skies of Ilmera with this gorgeous GM Screen, digitally painted by impressionist artist Andreas Rocha. The front of the screen pans from the golden wheat fields of Gildai, across the capital city of Kelscariss, before ending in the volcanic vineyards of Caldra. The reverse has helpful DnD 5E quick-reference rules and advice.

Hand out a dragon's hoard of loot to your party with the Magic Item Deck. This set of 50 cards features all-new magic items taken from the world of Altheya, with full-colour art printed on the front and rules on the back. You'll get everything from Drake Bucklers to Protomagi Wands in one handy pack.

We've teamed up with the incredible musician and composer Jolene Khor to bring you three brand-new fantasy ambient soundscapes. Each piece has its own mood – calm, tense and panic. Use these audio tracks as the soundtrack to your games, whether you're riding through the wilds of Ilmera, or battling vaultspawn deep underground.
Jolene composed the Altheya theme tune, played before the High Rollers actual play show every week. If you haven't heard it before, listen below. It's beautiful.

Pick up a pack of Pre-Generated Characters and dive head-first into Altheya! It's the quickest way to sit down at the table and play, and is perfect for introducing new players to DnD 5E. Each pack comes with a party of four filled-in character sheets (art below), and twelve blank sheets for your own characters, all held together in a folder.

Take your Altheya games online with this huge pack of 50+ virtual tabletop tokens, compatible with Roll20, Foundry, and all other VTTs. The pack features characters and monsters from across the provinces of Ilmera. All art is taken from the Altheya: The Dragon Empire book.

What better way to carry your Ignarious Liquid Core Dice Set and your Crucible of Fate Dice Set than with a dice bag emblazoned with the Altheya: The Dragon Empire logo? The bag has a drawstring closure, and is large enough to hold two dice sets.

"Pulleth thine lever to receive thine fortune" – Clever Toad. The next time you swing by the town of Ashen Rest, insert this bronze coin into the clever toad machine and let the frog wizard divine your fate! This 1.5" bronze-finish coin is engraved with a Clever Toad design on one side, and an Ashen Rest design on the other.
Perfect to hand out as an inspiration marker, flip for those all-important 50/50 death saves, or as a weight for your notes and maps.
Missed the Clever Toad Bronze Coin earlybird reward? Don't fear! You can add the coin as an add-on to your pledge before you finalise your rewards.

Other award-winning Roll & Play Press products will be available in the pledge manager after the Kickstarter campaign closes. Why not throw in some adventures from One-Shot Wonders into your Altheya campaign, pepper in some interesting characters or locations from No Place Like Homebrew, or use the Map Library battle maps to bring your epic dragon encounters to life?
Please note, shipping will be calculated nearer our fulfilment date and charged to backers in the pledge manager after the campaign ($USD values are approximate based on current exchange rates).
If the project is fully funded, we have some exciting stretch goals planned to celebrate the achievement with our backers, and to make the rewards included in this campaign even better!
Check your pledge level to see whether you have chosen rewards that have been upgraded by the unlocked stretch goal.
Backers at the Empress Bundle pledge levels get all unlocked digital and physical stretch goals!
Here's a message with the Kickstarter link you can share with your friends and DnD party on WhatsApp, Reddit, Facebook, Discord, or wherever you chat about RPGs:

Check out Altheya: The Dragon Empire. It's a high-fantasy 5E campaign setting where you play a hero in a world ruled by dragon nobles! https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/rollandplaypress/high-rollers-altheya-the-dragon-empire?ref=2ps44r
Got a question? Just drop us a Kickstarter comment or send us an email.

Kickstarter will not charge shipping when the campaign ends. To make sure you get the most accurate shipping price, you'll pay for shipping and handling in Backerkit after you fill out your pledge manager. The prices are estimates based on February 2026.

Sales Tax and VAT, if applicable, is not included and will be charged in BackerKit. Packages are shipped by our fulfilment partners in the US, UK and Australia. We recommend backers check their local import rules to get more information on whether they may be charged additional customs fees.

• Tariffs have recently been introduced by the US. These are costs charged to us as the producer, and right now (February 2026) we don’t plan to pass these costs on to US backers. If tariffs rise in the future, there may be additional costs in the pledge manager after the campaign ends – but we’ll keep you updated. If that happens, you’ll also have the option to request a refund for your pledge.
We ship almost everywhere in the world. However, we can't ship to the following areas due to customs laws or situations outside our control:

Army Post Offices // Diplomatic Post Offices // Fleet Post Offices // Parcel Lockers // PO Boxes // Belarus // Falkland Islands // Faroe Islands // Guam // Moldova // Russia // Seychelles // Ukraine // Virgin Islands

Our creative and production schedules are all planned out! Our current timeline looks like this, but could change because of unforeseen circumstances or freighting delays. We'll keep you posted every step of the way with monthly Kickstarter updates.
Altheya is the setting of the weekly High Rollers DnD actual play series. The group is Europe's biggest TTRPG stream, has played sold-out live shows, and just celebrated 10 years of gaming.
The world was created by Mark/Mara "Sherlock" Hulmes (Critical Role, High Rollers, Thresher) and is brought to life on screen every Sunday on Twitch and YouTube.

This book is the definitive tabletop version of High Rollers' current campaign setting, which means you don't need any knowledge of the actual play series to use it! Everything you need to know about the world is contained in the book.
If you're a fan of the show, this is your chance to get all the lore of Altheya in one place, so you can easily run your very own adventures in this incredible world.
Keep up-to-date with all High Rollers news and releases on their website, YouTube, Instagram, Twitter, Patreon and Discord server.
Roll & Play Press is a UK-based TTRPG publishing team. Launched in 2020 by co-founders Sam and Kay, we’ve grown from a two-person passion project into a full creative studio.

Our work has won multiple industry awards and has been used by tens of thousands of players around the world. The team brings together writers, designers, editors, project managers and logistics experts who all share a love for DnD and tabletop gaming.

We’re gamers ourselves, and we know what it’s like to spend hours prepping or struggling before every session. That’s why everything we make is designed with one goal in mind: take the stress out of game mastering.
Keep up-to-date with all Roll & Play Press news and releases on their newsletter (comes with a free random table every month), Instagram and Discord server.
If this is your first time backing a Kickstarter campaign, welcome! Here’s how it works:
1. Back the campaign – Choose your pledge level and submit your pledge.

2. You’re charged when the campaign ends – Kickstarter only charges you if the campaign funds successfully. If you choose Pledge Over Time, your total will be split into smaller payments and charged in monthly increments.
3. Your pledge moves to BackerKit – A few weeks after the campaign ends, we’ll transfer your pledge to BackerKit. This is what we refer to as our 'pledge manager'.

4. You’ll get access to your pledge manager – BackerKit will email you an invite to confirm your details. Inside BackerKit you can add extra add-ons, switch your pledge level, pay for shipping, and update your address. If you add anything extra, you’ll be charged for it there. Shipping is also charged in BackerKit, not during the Kickstarter campaign. If you’re using Pledge Over Time, you won’t get access to your pledge manager until your final instalment has been paid.
5. We make the thing – Once pledges are locked, we go away and write, illustrate and design the book and all the rewards.

6. Everything is finalised – We send your rewards to print, approve samples and prepare for freighting. We’re planning to fulfil in Spring 2027. Your address won’t be locked until shortly before fulfilment, so if you move house between now and then, you’ll still be able to update it.
7. You receive your rewards – You will get a shipping notification from your local logistics warehouse when the time comes. Then, open that box when it arrives and dig into your rewards!

We’ll keep you updated – We’ll send regular email updates throughout the whole process, so you’ll always know what’s happening. If you have questions at any point, email us at hello@rollandplaypress.com and we’ll help you out.

comments.text: Question to those that back alot of campaigns. Do you feel stretch goals affect a campaigns momentum or is there just usually a natural progression to kickstarter (push at the start, push at the end).

replies.text: Stretch goals help - they encourage people to pledge as they get more for their money. And the first and last 48 hours or so usually see the most activity.

comments.text: I calculated how many hours of HR content I've enjoyed since diving into DND and I couldn't justify NOT getting the biggest bundle & no I don't want to share exactly how much that was. Love you guys - can't wait for more!
Quick Question: So I backed early, so I get one coin. I chose the Empress Bundle, so I get a second coin. So if I pick up another coin as an add-on, I'll get a third coin?

replies.text: Quick answer: YEP!

I have been with highrollers since day 1 And I have been preparing for this day a dream come true. I can't wait to see this book

I've been a High Rollers fan since very early in their first campaign, I've waited 10 years for this moment, I'm so excited. A lot of my worldbuilding has been very inspired by Mark/Mara's campaigns and worlds so why not get it straight from the source?

I've been watching high rollers since campaign 2 and have always loved there energy and im so glad to get the empress bundle and see all the cool stuff for this book.

I found High Rollers with the BG3 cast episode. They are what got me into DnD. I have always been interested but never took the jump. I’m starting my 4th campaign in 2 days. I’ll be running 2 at once. One online and one in person and might have a 3rd group that wants to start an in person as well. I do think it would be fun to actually get to play but also I do enjoy being the DM. Also I mean, you can’t go wrong with roll and play press. I think already have most of their books and I love the map library. It’s been really helpful for maps. Just wanted to say thanks and I can’t wait to see where your future collaborations take you.

Although I will happily run a 5e campaign using this, I wonder whether it would be possible to have a daggerheart campaign Framework, maybe even one per province? Even if you are not playing daggerheart, the framework could provide a starting point to decide with your group which province to play in.

FOR THE EMPRESS!! You guys got me into D&D with Lightfall and after a decade as the forever DM I can’t wait to get my hands on this book and go on another adventure!
Two queries if I may.

Are you worried that the price of some of the tiers could scare some people away from this. (sticker shock) Or think it`s a scam? I got the crownsteel edition because I know everyone here is cool, and because I believe in this project, and also think we`re getting what we`re paying for: a quality product.

replies.text: I think the price point of 3rd party DnD content has been fairly well established over the years, and while this one is slightly above average (at $60 for a book instead of $50), it reads more as indicative of inflation and content quality than as scam etc.

If you’re in the USA (like me) the higher price point is being caused by something they can’t control, the currency exchange rate. In pounds the prices are the same as most of the other kickstarters I or my husband have backed. Three hundred pounds for the empress crownsteel edition is great for the amount of merchandise you receive. However, due to the exchange rate it 405 dollars.

project.name: SUTEGOMA: Bad Blood
project.description: SUTEGOMA is a fast paced horror game in which you get rich or die trying (a lot)

creator.name: Tom
creator.biography: I'm a 2d illustrator known as Brassica, who moved to game dev to outplay the emergence of AI!

texte:
SUTEGOMA: BAD BLOOD is a fast-paced survival horror game blending old school game mechanics with the polish of modern horror - think Pacman meets Outlast.

You wake up inside an unknown facility with no memories - and a deep wound on your arm that won’t stop bleeding. 
Gold surrounds you, and so do three, very hungry demonic sisters. 
They watch. They stalk. They play. They devour.
Every second costs blood. 
Every coin tempts you to stay longer. 
Every run forces a choice: secure what you’ve earned, or risk everything for more. 
You might die again, and die again, and again, and again, but don’t worry - you’ll either learn to fight back or to enjoy the bliss of submission.
And next time, if you’re skilled or greedy enough, you might make it out not just alive, but rich.

You already met Renra in the teaser. She insists she’s the oldest - even though all three were born at the same moment.
They no longer remember the names they once had.
Their Father does, but he accepts what they became.
After all, he was the first one to give up his own name, then his humanity and his soul.
Anything that would keep them from dying.
When his money wasn’t enough to save them, he turned to the devil.
The sickness stopped, but it was replaced with something much more sinister.
Before all of this, they were regular girls - dreaming of fame, love and a career.
They are immortal now, and even though they don’t need to eat, they yearn for human blood and flesh.
He built the facility for them.
But because his own blood was never good enough for them, he invited You.

You’ll meet Miora and Kanera very, very soon.

Some of you know me as a 2D commission artist on X (Brassica). But game development has been my dream since childhood.
I never wanted to only illustrate ideas, I always wanted to create experiences.
SUTEGOMA is my attempt to combine modern visual quality with the kind of “gamey” design I grew up loving. Games where mechanics mattered. Where difficulty wasn’t optional. Where You had to beat the game rather than merely finish it.

Everything in the teaser - including the smartwatch HUD - exists in-engine and is built by me. I’ve been working on this project since september, learning, iterating, and refining as I go.
As all platforms crack down on content creators, and illustrators like me grow tired of competing with AI, I choose game design as my next step, and I hope you can help make my dream come true!

I know there’s not a lot of gameplay visible yet, but i chose to focus on building it, rather than making it pretty - but once this campaign is live, I’ll get back to development and do my best to showcase some work-in-progress gameplay on X

SUTEGOMA’s foundation is already built: core systems, main loop, initial monsters, and progression mechanics are in place.
Your support allows me to elevate the project beyond its base version. I can finish the game by myself, but as I’m slowly running out of savings, most of Base Goal will go towards my own survival while developing ;)
Other than that, funding will go toward:

Thank you for checking my project out, if you have any questions, write me an e-mail at: deathgangdev@gmail.com
or a DM at: https://x.com/DeathGangDev
(I won't try to be overly strict, but if request seems risky or against project's art direction, I'll have to deny it! if you're not sure, send me an e-mail or DM on X!, links above!)

project.name: Aorathian Shadow Architecture
project.description: Fortune isn’t read; It’s Forged. Cards that reveal the distortions clouding reality's nature so you can carve your own path

creator.name: Robin Richardson
creator.biography:
Robin Richardson is an artist and systems-thinker whose work explores agency, perception, and the mechanics beneath lived experience. 

She has a rich history as one of Canada's leading artists and poets, with international publications in journals such as Poetry Magazine, Salon, Tin House, The Walrus and others, and full-length collections such as Sit How You Want (Vehicule Press), which was the recipient of the Trillium Book Award and Relit Award. She is a MacDowell and Doris McCarthy Fellow and holds a BD in Design from OCAD and an MFA in writing from Sarah Lawrence College. She was also the founder of Minola Review, a journal of women's writing.

titre: Meet The Aorathian Anti-Oracle Deck : Shadow Architecture
texte: The average oracle deck coddles; AORATH’s Shadow Architecture reveals the distortions that cloud reality’s nature so you can chart your own course
Aorathian Shadow Architecture is a deck of 52 cards with 4 distinct suits: Shadows, Mirrors, Foundations, and Evolution.
Focus on your problem, draw a card, and ponder: If you’re bold enough to face what you find, you just might break the cycles sabotaging your evolution
Born direct experiential wisdom and incidentally aligned with Stoic, Taoist, Buddhist, and Gnostic offerings

2.5 x 3.5 (pocket sized!) 
Matte 350 gsm premium card stock
These cards hold you to a high standard because they understand that evolution begins with the self and expands outward to reflected experience

Those actively dedicated to improving their circumstances and the circumstances of those around them; who care more about clarity and growth than comfort, and who are willing to examine their own blind spots and inherited patterns.

Each card helps you identify feedback you may be avoiding, recognize what might be distorting reality, and stabilize your systems, creating scalable foundations free of blind spots and hidden saboteurs.
This deck does not tell you what will happen. It helps you change what may happen before it has a chance to materialize, not through magic, but through advanced pattern recognition.

Aorathian Shadow Architecture is not for those who wish to see into the future, reinforce self-image, cling to the light, or find constant confirmation. They are not going to tell you what opportunities are on the horizon or what love is coming in and they are certainly not going to let you get away with beliefs and behaviour that sabotage your future.

Aorathian Shadow Architecture stresses the importance of honest self-reflection and personal checks & balances to ensure progress without the lag of misaligned thoughts and actions. The more you practice these principles, the easier it becomes, and the more expansive & aligned your experience
The deck is structured into four interlocking suits, each representing a phase of engagement with reality:
Shadows — hidden influences, loose ends, deep cleaning
Mirrors — perception, framing, discernment, self- and other-reflection
Foundations — procedures, systems engineering, endurance, refinement
Evolution — divergence, elevation, transgression, innovation, completion, renewal

The suits are cyclical rather than hierarchical. Progress moves from disruption to perception to stabilization to expansion — then loops back again at a deeper level.

Do not be fooled by the illusion of finality. This is an eternal game.

The deck features public-domain artwork drawn from vintage scientific manuals, diagrams, and visionary sources, including Hilma af Klint and Manly P. Hall. The visuals were chosen not just for symbolism, but for structural resonance, with each suit carrying its own visual signature.
Robin Richardson is an artist and systems thinker whose work explores mastery of the mechanics that govern experience.

She has a rich history as one of Canada’s leading artists and poets. Her last full-length collection of poems, Sit How You Want, was the recipient of the Trillium Book Award and the ReLit Award. She is a MacDowell and Doris McCarthy Fellow and holds a BDes in Illustration from OCAD University and an MFA in Writing from Sarah Lawrence College. She is also the founder of Minola Review, a journal of women’s writing.
This deck is the culmination of Robin’s inner transformation; a map she wishes she’d had herself and now offers to others.
She believes in systems that work toward better outcomes rather than ones that comfort and console, having learned firsthand the dangers of neglecting inner work in exchange for illusory ease.
Take each card as both diagnosis and prescription, and administer it with a humble ego and a willing heart.

The deck and guidebook are both fully designed and will be sent to the printer on Feb 25. It will take 2.5 weeks to process the printing and an additional 6-8 weeks to ship, putting the completion of the project around mid to late spring.
We will be printing with Qin Printing, one of the top rated printing houses in the country and will be doing a run of 400 cards and 300 guidebooks totalling just over $3400 after shipping and taxes
Shipping: I will be shipping items in recyclable padded envelopes using Canada Post and bend-resistant backing where needed.
Aorathian Shadow Architecture is complete, tested, and ready for print.
This campaign exists to fund:
High-quality card production
Sustainable printing
Packaging and distribution
The continued development of Aorathian Maps & Artifacts
By backing this project, you’re not just supporting a deck, you’re helping bring a clear, actionable alternative to space dominated by passive fortune telling and affirmation
Make your pledge now
Much love,
Robin Richardson

They released their self-titled debut album in 2016, followed by Postcard Town in 2017, Cheers to Solitude in 2020 and It's a Complicated Life in 2023.

project.description: A blend of spoken word, electronic textures. Help fund the production, mastering, visuals, and limited physical editions.

creator.name: Charles Kuzmanovic
creator.biography:
I am Charles S. Kuzmanovic — a technical architect, communications designer, electronic musician, and lifelong explorer of sound, systems, and human experience. Born into a multicultural environment and shaped by the edges of urban life, I’ve always moved between worlds: technology and art, structure and intuition, clarity and intensity. My work grows from that intersection.
For more than two decades, I’ve built complex digital systems, designed brands, and created music that blends emotional depth with technical precision. Whether I’m producing electronic textures, writing spoken‑word pieces, or shaping visual identities, my focus is always the same: authenticity, resonance, and a sense of inner truth.
Music has been a constant companion throughout my life — a place where I can translate experience into sound. Over the years I’ve released projects across alternative electronic music, experimental hip hop, and atmospheric sound design.

project.name: Mellow 20th Birthday YouTube Online One-Man Live
project.description: — ため息を詩と音で、そっと包む夜 — A night that gently wraps your sighs in poems and sound —

creator.name: Mellow
creator.biography:
真真夜中と夜明けのあいだに、あなたへ小さな唄をあげる。
雨と滲んだ街明かりを抱えて帰って、コーヒーに癒される。 
ため息を詩と音でそっと包めば、一本の蝋燭が生まれるの。 
それが、あなたの胸のいちばん奥で、やさしく灯りますように。
 —Mellow 
In the space between midnight and dawn, I leave you a little song. 
I come home carrying rain and streetlights smeared into neon, 
and let coffee mend me. 
If I fold my sighs into poems and sound, a lone candle is born—
may it burn softly in the deepest room of your heart. 
—Mellow 

Mellow
Vocaloid Artist
Debut single: “Black Cat” (February 25, 2025)
Date of Birth: February 22, 2006
Zodiac Sign: Pisces
Hobbies: Night walks, collecting cassette tapes, writing poetry
Favorites: The sound of rain, coffee and chocolate, record shops
Favorite Animal: Black cat
Dream: A New Year’s Eve live show at Nippon Budokan
Music genre: LoFi-HipHop, Chill, Jazz (ChillHop)

Mellow-禁断の果実Forbidden Fruit-

project.name: The Flyin' A's New Album- Out May 2026
project.description: 100% independent new album by the powerhouse duo The Flyin' A's. Brand new music created with a transatlantic collaborative team!

creator.name: Hilary Adamson
creator.biography:
The Flyin’ A’s are a fully independent musical duo, blending heartfelt Americana with a bold Texas kick. They’re in the middle of recording their next album with legendary producer Ron Rogers in Wales, UK — and now they need the support of their community to bring this music to the world. Be part of making it happen!

This  husband and wife duo hails from Austin, Texas. You can hear their Texas roots in all they do.  This high energy duo is famous for their top notch songwriting, breathtaking harmonies, and exceptional live performance.  Their latest album You Drive Me Crazy was selected to be on the 2017 first round Grammy Ballot and has taken them on tour around the US, UK, New Zealand and EU.  From Stuart Adamson's outstanding lead guitar work and gritty vocals to Hilary Claire Adamson's powerhouse vocal gymnastics and lilting harmonies, it is no wonder this duo is quickly gaining momentum both at home and abroad.  They combine the best of Texas country, southern blues, folk and gospel to create an original sound that is all their own.

project.name: The Circle of Legacy
project.description: Preserving Family Stories for Generations

creator.name: Dani
creator.biography:
I’m Dani — a Wisconsin photographer, mother, and legacy storyteller, and the founder of Dani Marie Photography. I began photographing weddings because I was drawn to beginnings — the moment a family starts. Over time, that work naturally grew into family and legacy portraiture, where I now spend most of my time preserving the relationships and histories that unfold after those beginnings.

Across the years, I’ve created albums and portraits that have become part of family life — displayed on walls, held by children, and passed down. I’ve seen how photographs move from being “pictures” into becoming memory anchors, storykeepers, and heirlooms. That transformation is what defines my work.

My approach has always centered on connection over perfection. I photograph how families actually are with each other — the closeness, the belonging, the quiet emotion — and then translate those moments into tangible artwork designed to last far beyond digital files or trends.

As Dani Marie Photography has grown, so has the vision: a dedicated legacy portrait studio where families can gather, be photographed intentionally, and celebrate their story through reveal and artwork experiences. Through this Kickstarter, I’m building the Dani Marie Legacy Portrait Studio and inviting families to become founding supporters of a space created entirely for preserving what matters most — the people we love and the stories we share across generations.

project.name: Lens Lizard: A remote controlled backup camera cleaner
project.description: Your backup camera should clean itself. Now it does. One press clears snow, salt, and grime so you can actually see where you're going.

creator.name: Mike Klein
creator.biography:
Hey, it’s Mike.
Lens Lizard started because my backup camera was dirty more often than not—especially in winter. You can wipe it before you leave, but when you pull into daycare in the dark, you’re stuck getting out again just to park safely. I tried hydrophobic covers and ceramic coatings—both useless. Then I noticed luxury cars had this built in. I wanted a simple retrofit: no drilling, no wiring, just a standalone unit that lasts all winter and refills like washer fluid. Lens Lizard is the result—and honestly, it’s a blast to use.
